1.content:
“Come on, Brian!” from downstairs, my younger brother Aaron called out, “We’re going to hit traffic if we don’t leave soon!”

“Give me a minute, Aaron!” Packing my things into my backpack, I said, “I’m almost ready.”

My name is Brian Summers; and I live in Glen Lake, NY with my dad and younger brother. My dad is an accountant for a local bank. My mom died 3 years ago of cancer. Aaron and I get along fine; but we’re polar opposites in some ways. He’s into sports; while I’m the more studious sibling. He was also more popular with the girls; whereas I wasn’t so popular.

That being said, I enjoy playing basketball with my friends Patrick and Eric after school.

Once I was sure I’d gotten everything, I walked downstairs to find Aaron waiting at the front door. We were both around 5’10” and looked alike; so it was easy to tell that we were brothers.


After getting in my car; we drove 10 minutes to school. It didn’t take long to find a parking spot; once we got there, Aaron and I went our separate ways.

Walking into school, I found Patrick and Eric waiting by my locker. The three of us had known each other since Kindergarten; we did everything together.


School went by without incident; except for a humorous encounter between Aaron and Kelly O’Rourke at lunch. Aaron’s had a crush on her since 8th grade; but she never gives him the time of day. Kelly was the most popular girl in the sophomore class; along with her friends Amber Riley and Samantha Paterson.

I was walking into the lunch when it happened; I watched as Aaron walked over to Kelly’s table and asked if she’d like to go to the movies tonight. I give him credit for trying; but when is he going to learn that Kelly’s answer will always be no.

After being rejected by his crush; Aaron graciously said goodbye and went off to join his friends.


Once school got out, Aaron and I met up with Patrick and Eric by my car. Looking at Aaron, Patrick said, “You want to play basketball with us, Aaron?”

“Sure, why not.”


We all got to my house a short time later. After putting our things inside, Aaron and I joined the others in our driveway. The game proceeded without incident; with Aaron and me leading 10-7.

I had the ball in hand and threw it; missing the hoop and rolling down the driveway. Running after it, I picked up the ball just in time to hear a car’s horn.

Turning around, the last thing I remember seeing was a truck rushing towards me.
1.title: The Beginning

11.content:
When I finally woke up, I found myself in a hospital bed. Sitting up in bed, I suddenly felt something brush against the back of my neck.
Reaching back, I pulled back some strands of hair. “How long was I asleep!?”

Getting out of bed, to see just how bad my hair was, I made my way to the bathroom. Careful to take the IV stand with me; I failed to notice the extra weight on my chest.

Turning on the lights in the bathroom, I saw something completely unexpected in the mirror. Not only was my hair down to my shoulders, but I had…BREASTS!?

In a panic, I pulled up the hospital gown to find that I now had a vagina. Screaming at the top of my lungs, I barely had time to realize how high-pitched the scream was before I fainted and fell to the floor.


I woke up sometime later to find a young nurse, in her 20s, standing at the foot of my bed. I felt...off; so it didn’t take long to realize I was given drugs to calm myself down.

Looking at the nurse, I said, “W-What happened to me?”

“You were hit by a truck, Brian.” Walking over, checking my stats, the nurse said, “Your lower body was nearly crushed.”

“Why did that involve turning me into a girl?”

“There wasn’t...much left down there; so the doctors did what they could.”

As the nurse turned to leave, I said, “H-How long have I been here?”

Turning to me, in a sad tone, the nurse said, “Almost 6 months.”
11.title: Waking Up To A Big Change

111.content:
I don’t know how long it was before the door opened again; this time to reveal Aaron and my dad. I didn’t know what to say to them; so I just stared at them as they walked over to my bedside.

Looking at me, dad said, “It’s good to see you’re finally awake, Brian.”

“To be honest, I’m hoping this is a dream.” Sighing, I said, “That I’m going to wake up and still be a boy.”

“I’m sorry, kiddo. But,” looking at me, Dad said, “This is real.”

Looking at dad, tearing up, I said, “How could you let them do this me!?”

“I didn’t have much of a choice, Brian.” Taking a breath, Dad said, “This was really the only viable way to give you a normal life.”

“Normal!?” getting angry, I said, “You call waking up to find you’re a girl NORMAL!?”

“Calm down, Brian.” Trying to calm me down, Dad said, “This is a big change for everybody!”

“I don’t see your world completely turned upside down!”

“Brian.” Looking at me, Aaron said, “This hasn’t been easy for us; you being a coma for 6 months.”

“Forgive me if I don’t care about you’ve been through; my life is over!”

Rather than try to reason with me, Dad simply turned and ushered Aaron out of the room. Before closing the door, dad turned to me and said, "We'll talk later, when you are able to stay calm, young lady."

Hearing that, I burst into tears as the door closed. As I cried, I wondered why I was being so emotional all of a sudden.
111.title: A Family Visit

1111.content:
I must’ve dozed off; because I woke up to find the nurse in my room again. Looking at her, I saw that this time she had a tray of food. As she placed the tray in front me, she said, “How’d it go with your family?”

“Could’ve been better.” Sighing, I said, “I was really emotional for some reason.”

“That would be your new hormones.” Looking at me, she said, “You’re not used to them yet; so don’t be surprised if you experience mood swings.”

Taking a bite of the food, I said, “Great; as if being a girl wasn’t bad enough.”

“I’m sure you’ll adjust in time.”

Sighing, I said, “Thanks...”

“My name’s Rachel.”

“Thanks...Rachel.”


Once I was finished eating, Rachel helped me to the bathroom so I could relieve myself. Closing the door behind her, I finally had the opportunity to look at my new body. Stripping out of the gown, I turned to the mirror to find a girl’s body staring back at me.

Looking closer, I saw there was nothing left that would’ve let people know I was a boy. I looked like a normal girl. “Those must be some strong hormones.”

After looking at my breasts; which if I had to guess were slightly smaller than a C cup, my eyes ventured down towards my waist. I wondered what the doctor’s had to do in order to give me a figure; they probably had to do some major surgery down there.

Having had enough, I put the gown back on and opened the door. Seeing Rachel standing by my bed, I said, “I’ve got a question for you.”

“Okay.” Walking over to me, she said, “Ask away.”

“If those hormones can cause mood swings; what else could they do to me?”

“Look at your chest.” With a grin, Rachel said, “Those breasts are natural; no implants whatsoever.”

“Really!?”

“Yeah.” Helping me into bed, Rachel said, “You would’ve been out of the coma almost 2 months ago; but the doctor wanted to give your body time to adjust to the hormones."
1111.title: Visit from the Nurse

11111.content:
I fell asleep pretty easily that night; probably because of the drugs being pumped into me. I woke up just as the sun started to peek through the window the next morning.

Sitting up in bed, I soon realized that I’d been disconnected from the IV. “Probably weaning me off the drugs.”

I had a few moments to myself, before Rachel came into the room. “Morning, Brian.”

“Morning, Rachel.” Looking at her, I said, “How are you, today?”

“I’m doing fine.” Walking over to me, Rachel said, “How about you?”

“Pretty good; considering what’s happened to me.”

Checking my vitals, Rachel said, “Your father is outside; he...wanted to talk to you.”

“Okay.” Sighing, I said, “Let him in.”


It wasn’t long before dad was standing by my bed. “Hi, kiddo.”

“Hi dad.” Pausing, I said, “Where’s Aaron?”

“He’s at home.” Sighing, he said, “I wanted a chance for just you and I to talk.”

“About what?” getting defensive, I said, “How you let the doctors turn me into a girl?”

“I didn’t have much of a choice, Brian.” Looking at me, Dad said, “It was either this; or they’d make you a sexless male.”

“Shouldn’t I have been a part of the decision making?” looking at Dad, I said, “This is my life we’re talking about.”

“They needed a decision almost as soon as you got here, Brian.” Taking a breath, Dad said, “You were losing a lot of blood; and there wasn’t enough time to wake you up before it was too late.”

“I don’t know the first thing about being a girl!”

“I’ll help you with that.” Pausing, Dad said, “As soon as you’re out of the hospital, we’ll go shopping for your new wardrobe.”

“New wardrobe?” confused, I said, “What’s wrong with my old one?”

“I don’t know if you’ve noticed. But,” pausing, Dad said, “Your new frame is...smaller than it was before the accident.”

Looking down, I realized that Dad was right. I’d weighed about 180 before; but now I’d have to guess that I weighed 130 when wet. “Okay, fine.” Sighing, I said, “But nothing girly.”

“That’s okay with me.” Pausing, Dad said, “Patrick and Eric are planning to come by later; they’re relieved to hear that you’re awake.”

“Have they...seen the new me?”

“Yeah, they have.” Looking at me, dad said, “I’m not entirely sure they’re used to it yet.”
11111.title: The Next Day

111111.content:
I spent the next couple hours watching TV; anything to keep my mind off of what’s happened to me.

I was in the middle of watching a rerun of Family Guy when I heard a knock at the door. Realizing who it was, I couldn’t help but feel nervous. I didn’t want them to see me as a frightened girl, so I sat up in bed; thankful that the sheets covered most of my body.

“Come on in.”

The door opened; revealing Patrick and Eric with weak smiles on their faces. Looking at me, Patrick said, “Hey man...what’s up?”

Before I could say anything; Eric elbowed him in the ribs. I guess they thought I’d take it badly. With a low chuckle, I said, “I’ve been better; I think I need a haircut.”

Both of them looked at me as if they didn’t know what to say. I couldn’t blame them; I didn’t know how I’d react if one of them was in my situation. Looking at me, awkwardly, Eric said, “You look fine, man.”


We spent the next 20 minutes talking; albeit awkwardly. I liked it better this way; it was better than having them avoiding me.

As we spoke, I suddenly thought of something. I knew this would inevitably come up; so I decided to get it over with. Looking at them, I said, “Does the school know?”

With a grimace, Eric said...
111111.title: A Visit From Friends

1111111.content:
“Everyone knows, man.” Wincing, Patrick said, “They called a school assembly after Aubrey Mitchell blabbed to the entire school about it.”

Aubrey Mitchell was the biggest gossip in school. Looking at Patrick, I said, “How did she find out?”

“Her mom’s on the nursing staff; she overheard her mom talking on the phone with one of the doctors.”

“The principal got on stage with the school nurse and the surgeon who’d operated on you.” Chiming in, Eric said, “They explained what happened; and how there was so much damage that making you a girl was the only way to give you a normal life.”

“You call this normal?” sighing, I said, “What’s normal about this?”

Wincing, Eric looked at me and said, "Take it easy, man; we have to adjust to this just as much as you."

"Oh really?" looking at them, my emotions getting the better of me, I said, "Unless I'm mistaken, you've never woken up from being in a coma for 6 months to find out that you'd been turned into a girl."

Looking at me, Eric said, "I-I didn't mean it like that..."

Glaring at them, I said, "Both of you get out!"

They both looked at me in silence for a moment; before quietly walking out of the room. After they closed the door, I made a note to ask Rachel about how severe these mood swings would get before I adjusted.
1111111.title: Yes

11111111.content:
I was alone for a little while before Rachel walked into the room. Seeing the angry look on my face, she said, "Uh oh; what happened?"

"My friends said something...insensitive." sighing, I said, "I kind of lost my temper with them."

"Didn't I warn you about the mood swings?" With a chuckle, Rachel said, "They'll subside in time; but if you want I can see about getting you something to manage them."

"I was actually going to ask you about that." Sitting up in bed, I said, "I'd prefer not to lose my temper every time someone says the wrong thing."

"That comes with being a girl, Brian; we sometimes let our emotions get the better of us." Smiling, Rachel said, "Just be thankful you can miss out on having periods; where the mood swings are much worse."

Rachel and I talked for a little while before she went to get me some sedatives. After she returned with them, I swallowed one and said, "Where's my dad?"

"He's on his way; I called to tell him you were awake."
11111111.title: Later On

111111111.content:
Rachel and I talked for a while as the sedatives took effect. She told me how she was originally from Connecticut and she came out to Buffalo for school. It was nice talking to Rachel about something other than my predicament; it made me feel like everything was going to be alright.

We were so engrossed in our conversation that we didn’t realize my dad was standing in the doorway. Making his presence known, Dad said, “Rachel, can I speak to my...daughter in private?”

“Sure thing.” Getting up, Rachel said, “I’ll be right outside if you need me.”

After Rachel closed the door behind her, Dad turned to me and said, "I wanted to apologize for what I said earlier; you're still in shock over this and it wasn't right of me to call you a young lady."

"It's okay." Turning to Dad, I said, “I guess everything that's happened was too much for me to handle."

"I can understand how you may feel overwhelmed by all of this; but know that everyone is willing to help you."

"I may feel overwhelmed?” shocked, I said, "Dad, I just woke up from being in a coma for 6 months to find out that I've been turned into a girl."

“I suppose I can’t fault you for acting like that. But,” pulling a chair over to my bedside, Dad said, “You have to understand that I did what I thought was best for you.”

"I understand that you had my best interests in mind when you agreed to this. But," Leaning back in the bed, I said, "It's going to take me a while to accept this."

Taking my hand, Dad said, “We’ll help you through this, Brian.”

We talked for a little while; with dad filling me on everything that’s happened while I was in the coma. I was happy to learn that my 23 year old cousin got engaged to her boyfriend of 3 years.

It was getting close to the 7:00 when Dad decided to leave so I could rest. As dad got up to leave, I turned to him and said, “When do you think I can leave the hospital?”

“The doctor wants to keep you under observation for a few days.” Looking at me, Dad said, “You’ll be out just before school starts.”

“That's just great." With a chuckle, I said, "Not only do I have to adjust to being a girl; but now I'm starting my senior year as well.”

“Actually, you won’t be a senior.” Looking at me, with a wince, Dad said, “You’ll be repeating junior year.”

Shocked, I said, “WHAT!?”

“Think about it, Brian; you were in a coma for the last 3 months of school.” Pausing, Dad said, “The school feels you should repeat junior year to get what you missed.”

“Great.” Sighing, I said, “Got any more surprises?”

“Actually, there is something else.” Taking a breath, Dad said, “Your new name is Allison Elena Summers.”


Dad left soon after that; to give me some time to think about everything he’d told me. It wasn’t long before one of the evening nurses delivered my dinner; lasagna and a salad. After eating dinner, I decided to go to bed early.
111111111.title: Dad Comes By

1111111111.content:
I found myself outside the men’s room at the mall; feeling as if I had to go to the bathroom. Walking inside, I made my way to a urinal.

I was about to unzip my pants when the guy next to me started to chuckle. Looking at him; it wasn’t long before everyone else in the room was staring at me and laughing.

Suddenly a mall security office came over. “I’m sorry, I’ll have to ask you to leave.”

“What?” confused, I said, “Why?”

Chuckling, the officer said, “For one thing; you’re in the wrong bathroom.”

Looking down, I saw that I was female. Blushing from embarrassment, I turned to walk out of the bathroom just as I woke up in the real world.
1111111111.title: Dreaming

11111111111.content:
I woke up almost immediately; surprised to find that it was already morning. Looking at the window, I saw that it was raining out. As I went to get out of bed, I suddenly felt ‘wet’ down between my legs.

Pulling the covers off, I looked down and went pale when I saw a small puddle of blood on the mattress. That was enough to throw me into a panic; it wasn’t long before several nurses ran into the room.

One of them, when they saw what was happening, said, “I’ll get Rachel.”

While the other nurse left the room, another came over and tried to calm me down. “It’s okay, sweetie; you’re going to be fine.”

“Fine!?” still in a panic, I said, “I-I’m bleeding!”

“You just pulled out a few of your stitches, Allison.” Looking at me, the nurse said, “We'll have that fixed immediately."

"Stitches?" confused, I said, "I thought the operation was 6 months ago?"

"The doctors thought it would be best to wait until you'd stabilized; you almost died in the ambulance." sighing, the nurse said, "The last part of the operation was almost 2 weeks ago; where the doctor's surgically altered your bone structure to give you a girl's figure."

It wasn’t long before Rachel came into the room; walking over to my bed. “Calm down, Ally; everything’s going to be fine.”


Rachel quickly sewed up my incision; after which I said, "Thanks, Rachel.”

“No problem.” Chuckling, she said, “I've torn stitches in my sleep a few times; I know what it's like.”

After making sure I was alright, Rachel left to do her rounds. Once she was gone, I leaned back in bed and tried my best to go back to sleep.
11111111111.title: Waking up

111111111111.content:
The next few days passed by slowly; when I wasn’t being examined by doctors, I was relaxing in the hospital room. Finally the day came where I was being released from the hospital; which was good because I was going stir crazy.

I was standing in the bathroom; having just gotten dressed, when Rachel came into my room. As she saw me standing in the mirror, looking at me reflection, she said, "How’s that outfit fitting you?”

“It fits great.” Looking at Rachel, I said, “Thanks for buying it for me.”

“No problem, Allison.” Chuckling, Rachel said, “I didn’t think you’d like it if your dad bought your first girl outfit.”

“No, probably not.”

Before leaving the room, Rachel graciously put my hair into a ponytail; which I had to admit looked nice.


After saying goodbye to all the nursing staff, I joined Aaron and dad at the elevator. It was then I realized I was about to leave the hospital as a girl; which made me a little nervous.

“It’ll be alright, Al.” Looking at me, Aaron said, “I’m here for you.”

That was all I needed to hear; before stepping into the elevator. It wasn’t long before we were walking to the car.


Getting into the car, dad turned to me and said, “Tomorrow I’ll take you to the mall so you can buy yourself a new wardrobe, okay?”

“Okay; thanks.”

Pulling out of the parking lot, Dad said, “For now; there’s a welcome home party for you at the house.”
111111111111.title: Leaving the Hospital (A Few Days Later)

1111111111111.content:
The drive home was uneventful; with both dad and Aaron leaving me alone. I looked out the window at the passing scenery; wondering how I was going to deal with this huge change in my life.

It wasn’t long before we turned onto my street; where I saw almost a dozen cars parked in front of my house. As my dad pulled into the driveway, I looked up to see a banner hanging off the garage that read “Welcome Home, Allison!!”

The moment I got out of my car, I was overrun with hugs from family members. My grandparents were overjoyed to see that I was alright; although they both said they needed to get used to me being a girl.

I soon found myself on the front porch with my cousins; from 5 year old Connor to 23 year old Melissa. They were all supportive of me; even if my 9 year old cousin Mark thought I had cooties now.


After talking with my cousins for a while, I went up to my room to relax. Walking into the room, I was relieved to see that it was the same as I’d left it 6 months ago.

Sitting on my bed, I was about to close my eyes when I heard a knock on the door. Looking up, I saw Melissa standing in the doorway.
“Hey Mel, what’s up?”

Walking in, taking a seat on my bed, Melissa said, “I just wanted to see how you’re doing with all this.”

“I’m dealing with it; it’ll be a while before I’m okay with this.”

Melissa was silent for a moment; before looking at me, “Ally, there’s something I wanted to ask you.”

Sitting up, I said, “What is it, Mel?”

“No doubt your dad told you I got engaged?”

“He did.” Smiling, I said, “Congratulations.”

“Thanks.” Pausing, Melissa said, “I-I was wondering if you’d be one of my bridesmaids.”

Shocked, I said, “What?”

“I’ll understand if you don’t want to; considering you’re still adjusting to being a girl. But,” looking at me, Melissa said, “I’d love for you to be in the bridal party.”

I was shocked; I’d only been a girl for 4 days and I was already being asked to be a bridesmaid in my cousin’s wedding. I thought about it for a moment, before looking at Melissa and said, “I’d be honored to be one of your bridesmaids, Mel.”

“Great!” hugging me, Melissa said, “I promise the dress won’t be too girly.”

Hugging her back, chuckling, I said, “Thanks, cuz.”
1111111111111.title: The Welcome Home Party

11111111111111.content:
No one seemed to mind that I wasn’t really in the mood for a get-together; they just let me do my own thing while they spent time with family. With that being said, several of my cousins came to visit me in my room.

It was nice to spend time with them; although I could tell they were still unsure how to behave around me.

I was glad when Eric and Patrick came by to visit. I’d just gone into the kitchen to grab a plate of food, when I saw them walk in the front door.
Seeing me, they smiled and walked over. “Welcome home, Bri...Allison.”

“Thanks, guys.” Hugging them, I said, “It’s good to see you.”

After saying hello to everyone, Patrick and Eric followed me up to my room. As we walked down the hall, Eric said, “You're not going to yell at us again, are you?”

“No, I'm not going to yell at you guys.” Walking into my room, I said, “I was just experiencing a bad mood swing from the hormones; and it got the better of me.”


We talked for a little while; about how they’re looking forward to being seniors. I envied them; I had to repeat junior year while my best friends were a grade ahead of me.

They were both surprised when I told that I’d agreed to be a bridesmaid in Mel’s wedding; wondering if I’d be adjusted by then. We watched movies for a while; before they had to leave. It was around that time that everyone else started to leave to; everyone wishing me luck as they left.

I spent the rest of the afternoon keeping to myself; I wanted to be alone for a while.


It wasn’t until dinner was ready that I finally left my room. As I sat down at the table for my first home cooked meal in 6 months, I saw that dad had made meatloaf for dinner. While it wasn’t restaurant quality, it was better than the hospital food I’d eaten for the last few days.

As he placed some meatloaf on my plate, Dad said, “Did you have a nice time, Allison?”

“Yeah, I did.” Pausing, I said, “It was nice to see that everyone’s supportive of me.”

Sitting down, Dad said, “Melissa mentioned something about talking to you this afternoon; what did you talk about.”

“Nothing much; she just asked how I was doing. Although,” pausing, I said, “She did ask me to be one of her bridesmaids.”

“Really?” surprised, Aaron said, “What did you say?”

“I told her I’d be honored to do it.” Taking a bite of the meatloaf, I said, “I figured that since it’s not going to be for another 7 months, I’d probably be more adjusted to being a girl by then.”

“I’m happy for you, sweetie.” Looking at me, Dad said, “It’s important that you accept what’s happened and not fight this.”

I decided to let dad calling me ‘sweetie’ slide. Looking at him, I said, “Thanks, Dad.”

It was clear that Aaron was uncomfortable with this discussion. Looking at me, he said, “Do you feel like playing video games later?”

“Sure, why not.” Chuckling, I said, “I’m a little rusty, though; so it might take me longer to kick your butt.”

Chuckling, Aaron said, “In your dreams, Ally!”

“I don’t want to up too late, Allison.” Looking at me, Dad said, “We’re getting up early tomorrow to buy you a new wardrobe.”

Sighing, I said, “Can’t wait, Dad.”
11111111111111.title: Later on

111111111111111.content:
I set my alarm to go off that 7:30; since my dad wanted to get to the mall before the crowds. As I woke up in my bed for the first time in 6 months, I found myself wishing I could just stay here. But I knew that wouldn’t happen, since I only had 2 outfits to my name.

After washing up and getting dressed, I made my way downstairs to find that Aaron and Dad were already wake. Seeing me, Dad said, “Good morning, Allison. How did you sleep?”

“Pretty good.” Chuckling, I said, “It’s nice to be in my own bed again.”

“That’s good.” Walking towards the hallway, Dad said, “Have some breakfast, we’ll be leaving shortly.”


After Dad left, I poured myself a bowl of cereal and sat down next to Aaron. As I started to eat, I noticed him looking at me. Feeling a little freaked out, I said, “What are you staring at, Aaron?”

“Nothing, Al.” looking at me, Aaron said, “I-I was just wondering how it feels for you to wear a bra.”

“What?” shocked, I said, “Why?”

“I just thought that since you’re not used to wearing them; they might feel...weird.”

“Oh.” Sighing, I said, “Well...it’s a little constricting; but it’s nice to have the support.”


Aaron and I talked for a few minutes until he’d finished his breakfast. After saying goodbye to me, he went up to his room. I was finishing up my breakfast when Dad walked back into the kitchen.

“Are you almost ready to go, sweetie?”

“Yeah, almost.”


It wasn’t long until we’d gotten to the mall. As I was about to get out of the car, Dad turned to me and said, “Wait up, Ally.”

Turning to Dad, I said, “What’s up?”

“I’ll admit I don’t know much about woman’s fashion. But,” pausing, Dad said, “I’d appreciate it if you tried on a few things that I pick out for you.”

“That’s fine, Dad.” Smiling, I said, “Just let me pick out some outfits too; since I’m the one who’ll be wearing them in public.”

Chuckling, Dad turned the car off and said, “Fair enough.”
111111111111111.title: The next day

1111111111111111.content:
After getting into the mall, Dad and I quickly made our way to Sears. Once we got there, we decided the first stop would be the underwear section.

As we looked through selection of bras to find ones that fit, I couldn’t help but wonder who was more embarrassed by the present situation; me or my dad. I didn’t take long to realize that dad was the most embarrassed; having to buy bras and other woman’s clothes for his former son.

After we found some bras that fit comfortably; the next step was the underwear. We spent about 10 minutes there; picking out the least feminine choices they had. I may be a girl now; but I’m not going to wear frilly or pink underwear.


We ran into the first familiar face when we got to the pants section; Kelly O’Rourke. I was looking at some capris when she stopped at a rack next to me. Rather than have an awkward silence between us, I turned to her and said, “Hi Kelly.”

A pair of pants in her hands, Kelly turned to look at me. For a moment it seemed as if she didn’t recognize me; until she said, “Brian Summers?”

“Yeah.” Blushing, I said, “I go by Allison now.”

“I heard what happened to you; I’m so sorry about that.” Looking at me, she said, “It’s good to see you’re out of the hospital.”

“Thanks.”

Kelly and I talked for a few minutes before she had to leave. Before she left, she handed me the pair of pants that were in her hands. “Try these on; you’ve got a better figure for than I do.”

I couldn’t help but blush at that; hearing my brother’s crush say I had a better figure than her. Although by looking at her, to my surprise, I realized that I had a better figure then Kelly. Taking the pants, smiling, I said, “Thanks, Kelly.”

Smiling, as she walked away, Kelly said, “See you at school, Allison.”


I continued to look through the pants until Dad came back; having gone off to pick out some shirts for me to try on. Putting them in the cart, Dad said, “I think we’ve got enough clothes for you to try on, don’t you think?”

“Yeah, I think we do.”

I then took the cart to the nearest dressing room; where I went into the first empty stall and closed the door. Looking at the shirts my dad picked; I was relieved to see that they weren’t overly feminine. There were some lighter colors; peach and cream, but nothing too bad.

I spent the next 20 minutes trying on the clothes; occasionally stepping out to show dad. After a while, I eliminated about 5 pairs of pants and 6 shirts from the pile; mostly because they didn’t fit right.


Walking out of the dressing room, I put the clothes that I wanted in the cart. Looking at me, Dad said, “Now we’ve just got to buy you some shoes; then we’ll go.”

As we walked through the store, I said, “How many pairs do I need?”

“If I learned anything from your mother; it’s that a woman should have shoes to match every outfit.” Looking at me, Dad said, “I think 3 or 4 pairs should be enough for now.”


We were finished with the shopping a short time later; after choosing 4 pairs of shoes that I liked. Walking up to the register, I said, “Thanks for doing this, dad; this is probably uncomfortable for you.”

“It’s not something I ever expected to do. But,” looking at me, Dad said, “You’re my daughter now; I want to help you any way I can.”


It wasn’t long until it was our turn at the register. As I was putting our purchases on the counter, the cashier reached under the counter and handed me what looked like a rather expensive purse.

Confused, I looked at her and said, “What’s this for?”

The cashier, a girl in her late teens, smiled and said, “The store heard what happened to you; please accept this purse as a gift from us.”

“Oh, I-I shouldn’t.” trying to hand the purse back, I said, “It’s too expensive.”

Pushing the purse back towards me, the cashier said, “Don’t worry; we’ll take care of it.”

I wanted to insist they take the purse back; but I soon realized that they were trying to be nice. Putting the purse in the cart, I smiled and said, “Thank you.”

“No problem.” Looking at me, with a smile on her face, she said, “With everything that’s happened; you deserve this.”


After paying for the purchases, Dad and I left the store to go home. As we walked to the car, I said, “Can I drive home?”

“I’m sorry, Ally.” Pausing, Dad turned to me and said, “You don’t have a license yet.”

“What?” confused, I said, “Yes, I do.”

“No, you don’t.” opening the trunk, Dad said, “Brian did.”

Sighing, I said, “When can I get a new license?”

“We’ll do that tomorrow; first thing so we don’t wait in line.”
1111111111111111.title: In The Mall

11111111111111111.content:
After getting home, Dad helped me bring my purchases up to my room. Aaron stayed quite as he helped carry some bags as well; clearly uncomfortable with the idea that I’d just bought girls’ clothing. He was benefiting from that however, as he was getting my old clothes.

With Aaron’s help, we took all my old clothes to his room. As I turned to go back to my room, Aaron said, “Let me know if you need any help, Ally.”

“Thanks.” Smiling, I said, “I will.”


I spent the next hour or so putting away my new clothes; watching a movie in the process. Once all my new clothes were put away, I sat down on the bed and gazed at my closet. I’d kept some of my favorite shirts as keepsakes; but for the most part my closet was full of girl’s clothes now.

It was rather depressing; thinking about how quickly I’d managed to replace all my clothing. Instead of dwelling on that, I decided to head to the bathroom to take a relaxing shower.

Walking into the bathroom, I closed but didn’t lock the door. After getting undressed, I turned on the water and stepped into the shower.

Pulling the curtain shot, I closed my eyes as the water hit my body. One of the many things I’d have to get used to was how sensitive my skin was.

Once my hair was sufficiently wet, failing to hear the bathroom door opening, I went to grab the shampoo. When I didn’t find it, I briefly wondered where it was before remembering I’d left it on the counter.

Reaching my hand through the curtain, I heard Aaron say, “Here you go, Ally.”

Without even thinking, I said, “Thanks, Aaron.”

It was only after a few seconds had passed that I suddenly realized what just happened. Throwing the shower curtain open, I saw Aaron sitting on the toilet with his mouth wide open and his face a deep red. It wasn’t long before I realized I was giving my younger brother the perfect opportunity to look at my chest.

Looking at Aaron, I said, “What the hell, Aaron!?”

Averting his eyes, Aaron said, "Could you cover yourself, or something?"

Wrapping the shower curtain around my chest, I said, “I’m a girl now; you can’t just come in here while I’m in the shower!”

“I’m...sorry, sis.” Extremely embarrassed, Aaron said, “I-I...forgot.”

“You forgot!?” gesturing to my chest, I said, “How could you forget; when I have these sticking out of my chest!?”

Without saying another word, Aaron quickly got up and left the bathroom.


Later on, after getting out of the shower and getting dressed, I decided to pay Aaron a visit. We spent some time talking about how since I was a girl now; things would have to be different around here. He couldn't simply come into the bathroom without knocking first; I'm not a boy anymore, so it wasn't appropriate for him to see me naked.

After Aaron and I finished talking, I excused myself to give him some privacy. As I walked back to my room, I realized that all of us were in for some adjustment.
11111111111111111.title: Back at home

111111111111111111.content:
I woke up the next morning to find that it was pouring outside. That was okay with me; other than going to the DMV, I didn’t plan on leaving the house today.

It took me longer than usual to get read this morning; I wasn’t used to my hair getting messed up during the night. After taking a shower, I dried off and went back to my room to get dressed. The first thing I did was grab a bra from the dresser. While most of the bras that I’d bought were white; I’d also picked out some black ones as well.

It was while doing that I realized black bras don’t work well with every top. I was getting my picture taken today for my new license, and I didn’t want a mistake like that to follow me for the next few years.

Once I was done getting dressed, I walked back into the bathroom to see about my hair. It took ten minutes of brushing to fix it; causing me to consider a shorter hairstyle.

After making sure I looked presentable, careful not wake Aaron, I walked downstairs to the kitchen. Going into the kitchen, I saw Dad reading the paper at the table.

Looking at him, I said, “Does this outfit look good for my photo?”

Looking up at me, a smile on his face, Dad said, “You look nice, Allison.”

While I wasn’t used to being a girl yet; it was still nice to be complimented. Smiling, I said, “Thanks, Dad.”


After I had a quick bite to eat, I said goodbye to Aaron and got in the car with dad.
111111111111111111.title: The next day

1111111111111111111.content:
Getting to the DMV, I was pleasantly surprised to find that there wasn’t a long line. After filling out the necessary paperwork to change my name; I joined Dad in line.


I didn’t have to wait that long; only spending about 10 minutes in line. Once it was our turn in line, we went over to a middle aged woman sitting behind the counter. Looking at her, Dad said, “My daughter’s here to a new driver’s license.”

“Okay.” Turning to me, the lady said, “What’s your name, sweetie?”

“Allison Samuels. But,” blushing, I said, “My name used to be Brian Samuels.”

“Brian Samuels?” the lady was silent for a moment, before looking at me. “Oh...I-I heard want happened to you; I’m terribly sorry.”

I was honestly getting tired of people saying they were sorry about what happened to me; but it was nice to see that people cared. With a weak smile, I said, “Thank you.”

As she glanced over my paperwork, the woman said, “For what it’s worth; you’re a lovely young lady.”

Blushing, I said, “Thanks.”


After she processed the form, the lady checked my eyesight before taking my picture. Looking at the picture, I was pleasantly surprised to see that I took a better license photo then I did as a boy.

Once I got my license, I thanked the lady and walked out of the DMV with dad. A smile on my face, I said, “Can I drive home?”

Opening the passenger side door, Dad said, “Sounds okay with me.”
1111111111111111111.title: At the DMV

11111111111111111111.content:
Before we drove home, Dad decided to treat me to lunch at Burger King. I wasn’t sure that was a good idea; until I realized Dad was doing this in order to bond with me.

Pulling into the parking lot, I slowly got out of the car and followed dad inside. It didn’t take long for us to order our food; along with something for Aaron.

I followed Dad to a corner table; where we sat down and ate our lunch. We talked over lunch about how I felt nervous about going to school tomorrow.

“I’m sure you’ll be fine, Ally.” Looking at me, Dad said, “You’ve got Patrick, Eric, and your brother to look out for you.”

“I’m sure they’ll do their best; but Patrick and Eric are seniors this year, they’ve got more important things to worry about then keeping me safe.”

“You’re their best friend, Allison.” Smiling, Dad said, “They’ll make time for you.”


Dad and I finished our lunches a short time later; after which I went to the ladies room to freshen up. I was very nervous about that; as it would be the first time I’d gone a public bathroom.

Walking into the bathroom, I saw another girl my age who was wearing a Burger King uniform. As I walked past the counter, she turned to look at me. It was at that point that I recognized her as Samantha Paterson; Kelly’s best friend.

With a nervous smile on my face, I said, “Hi Sam.”

Looking at me, confused, Sam said, “Do I know you?”

“Yeah.” Sighing, I said, “I was Brian Samuels.”

“Oh my God!” stunned, Sam said, “Kelly was right!”


Sam and I talked for a few minutes; as she was on her break at the time. She expressed her condolences for what happened to me; saying that she couldn’t imagine what I was going through.

As I turned to leave, I said, “See you at school, Sam.”

“Sounds good, Ally.” With a smile on her face, Sam said, “Take care of yourself, okay?”

Chuckling, I said, “I will.”
11111111111111111111.title: A Friendly Face

111111111111111111111.content:
I couldn’t help but feel upbeat as Dad and I drove home; people were treating me like I a real person with real feelings, instead of like a freak.
Dad had to go into work for a little while; so I asked him to drop me off at the end of the street. As I walked up the driveway, I saw Aaron standing anxiously next to a man in his late 40s.

As soon as he saw me, the doctor said, “Allison, I’m David Parker; one of the doctors who operated on you.”

Looking at the doctor, I couldn’t help but feel a little anxious; if someone from the hospital wanted to check up on me, they could’ve simply called me. Glancing at him, I said, “What can I do for you?”

“First off, Allison, I just wanted to say how beautiful you look.”

Something about the way he said that freaked me out. Looking at him, awkwardly, I said, “Thanks." pausing, I said, "What are you doing here?"

Stepping closer, Dr. Parker said, "I've a proposal for you; one that would benefit both of us."

"What; you can make me a guy again?"

"Unfortunately, I can’t do that." Pausing, Dr. Parker said, "What I'm asking is that you allow me to implant a uterus into your body; in order for you to experiences menstruation and have children."

"No thank you, doctor." Getting agitated, I said, "I've got enough to deal with now; I don't need to add having a period to the list."

"But...Allison; you'd be helping further my research." Looking at me, he said, "You're more female than anyone else who's undergone a sex change. All I'm asking is that..."

Walking past him, as Aaron opened the door, I said, “You’ve got 10 seconds to leave before I call the cops.”
111111111111111111111.title: A Proposal

1111111111111111111111.content:
Once we were inside the house, Aaron turned to look at me. “I’m sorry, Ally; I swear I didn’t know about that.”

“You don’t have to apologize, Aaron; it wasn’t your fault.” Sighing, I said, “If you don’t mind, I’d like some time to myself.”

“Okay.” As I walked upstairs, Aaron said, “I’ll call dad and tell him what happened.”


I spent the next hour or so in my room; trying to get my mind off that doctor. After watching some TV for a while; I realized I needed someone to talk to. As I sat up in bed, I knew the person I wanted to talk to.

Walking over to my desk, I grabbed the student directory from the drawer and looked up the number I wanted. With the number in hand, I got my phone and dialed it.

It wasn’t long before someone answered. “Hello?”

“Kelly?” pausing, I said, “It’s...Allison Samuels.”

“Hey, Allison!” pausing, Kelly said, “What’s up?”

I proceeded to tell her what happened with the doctor. When I was finished, I said, “I’m really like another...girl to talk to. Do you mind coming over?”

“Of course not; I’ll be right over.”


It was 15 minutes before I heard the doorbell. I was in the kitchen grabbing a snack when it rang. Running to the front of the house, I was about to reach for the door when Aaron came into the room. “Ally, wait! Dad said not to open the door.”

“Relax, Aaron.” Turning the knob, I said, “I know who it is.”

Opening the door, I saw Kelly standing there. Seeing me, she said, “Hey Ally.”

“Hey Kelly.” Stepping aside, I said, “Come on in.”

When Aaron saw Kelly, I swear his jaw dropped. “Kelly!?”

Chuckling, I said, “I believe you know my younger brother.”

“Hey, Aaron.” Pausing, Kelly said, “How are you?”

“Pr-Pretty good.” Composing himself, Aaron said, “W-What are you doing here?”

Glancing at Aaron, I said, “I called her; I needed someone to talk to.”


After talking with Aaron for a few minutes, Kelly and I went upstairs to my room while he went back to his video games. Once we were in my room, I closed my door and sat on the bed.

Sitting next to me on the bed, Kelly said, “So, you nervous about school tomorrow?”

“A little bit; mostly because I’m going back as a girl.”


The two of us talked for a little while; mainly about how I was adjusting to my new gender. After a while, Kelly suggested that we watch a movie to get my mind off everything. As I went to pick out a movie, to my surprise, Kelly hit me in the back with a pillow.

Startled, I spun around to find Kelly looking at me with a big grin on her face. “What did you that for?”

“When I’ve got something on my mind; I find a distraction is always a good remedy.” Tossing me a pillow, Kelly said, “Do you accept my challenge?”

With a grin of my own, I said, “Oh, it’s on!”

It wasn’t long before we were in a full blown pillow fight; laughing and having a good time as we hit each other with pillows. After a while, I tripped on my carpet and fell to the floor. Pinning me to the floor, a grin on her face, Kelly said, “Do you give up?”

Turning over on my back, chuckling, I said, “Never!”


We rough housed for a few minutes; until I got the upper hand and pinned Kelly to the floor. Both of us were exhausted at this point; but it was then that something strange happened. As we tried to catch our breath; I felt a weird sensation in my chest, almost as if my breasts were getting harder.

As if that wasn’t weird enough; I noticed the same thing happening to Kelly. It didn’t take long for me realize what was happening. “Holy shit!”

Before I could anything, Kelly had sat up and kissed me on the lips. I tried to resist; but I soon found myself kissing her back. It wasn’t long before we were making out with each other; as I started to feel wet in my pants.

We made out for what seemed like an eternity before we stopped; collapsing to the floor as we struggled to catch our breath. Looking at me, panting, Kelly said, “That...was...unexpected.”

Sitting up, I said, “What...just...happened?”

Sitting up and resting against the foot of my bed, Kelly said, “We...just...made out...Ally.”

“But why?” confused, I said, “We’re both...girls.”

"That doesn't mean anything." looking at me, Kelly said. "Girls kiss each other all the time, some experiment by taking it a step further as we did."

Still confused, I looked at Kelly and said, “So it’s...normal?”

“Yeah.” A grin on her face, Kelly said, “Was it good for you?"

I was a bit thrown off guard by the question. Looking at her, blushing, I said, “Yeah...it felt good.”


After we composed ourselves, Kelly and I went back to my room to watch a movie.

We were still watching the movie when Dad came home. Poking his head into my door, Dad said, “Hello, Allison.” Spotting Kelly, Dad said, “Who’s your friend?”

Gesturing to Kelly, I said, “This is Kelly O’Rourke.”

“Hi Kelly.” Pausing, Dad said, “I’m Allison’s father.”

“It’s nice to meet you, Mr. Samuels.”


Kelly left a few hours later; after staying for dinner. After saying goodbye to Kelly, I went upstairs to get ready for bed.

As I was in the bathroom brushing my teeth, Dad came into the room to talk. Looking at me, he said, “I’ve decided that I’m going to bring you to school tomorrow.”

Confused, I said, “Why?”

“Because of that doctor.” Looking at me, he said, “I’d feel better if I knew you were safe at school.”

“Okay.” Pausing, I said, “Thanks, dad.”

Hugging me, Dad said, “You’re welcome, kiddo.”


Once I was done brushing my teeth, I went back to my room. After getting an outfit together for tomorrow, I set my alarm and went to bed.
1111111111111111111111.title: Calling for help

11111111111111111111111.content:
I didn’t sleep very well that night; likely because I was really nervous about going back to school. Waking up around 5:45 the next morning, I quickly took a shower so Aaron didn’t have to wait until the last minute.


After a quick breakfast, I grabbed my things and followed Aaron out to dad’s car. I was hopeful that my first day back at school would be uneventful; but that changed when I saw what looked to be a mob of reports waiting outside the school.

Seeing that, I groaned, “Oh no.”

Looking at me, parking the car, Dad said, “Stay close, Allison.”

Getting out of the car, I got between Dad and Aaron as we walked towards the school. The reports surrounded me the moment I stepped onto the sidewalk. “Miss Samuels; you’re returning to school for the first time since your accident." Looking at me, a middle aged reporter said, “Are you at all nervous about how your peers will react?”

Before I could respond, another reporter said, “Is there any lady friend who’s helping you through this transition?”

“Will you still date girls, having the mind of a boy, or will the new hormones change that?”

Getting nervous, I said, “Dad...”

“Get out of here!” angrily, Dad said, “Leave my daughter alone!”

Just then a camera flashed in my face; temporally blinding me. Before I knew what was happening, someone grabbed my arm. I tried to pull away; when Aaron said, “Relax Ally, it’s me.”

As Aaron and Dad led me into school, the reporters continued to question me. “Miss Samuels, would you consider a romantic relationship in the future?”

“Miss Samuels...”

Finally having had enough, I yelled, “Leave me alone!!”

Before anyone knew what happened, a gunshot rang through the area. Everyone turned to see a police officer standing by his car; I relieved when I recognized him as Melissa’s fiancé, Leo.

In a calm, but firm tone, Leo said, “I’m going to ask that you all disperse immediately; before I have you arrested for harassing Miss Samuels.”

I was relieved to see the reporters start to leave; as Leo cautiously walked towards me. He was a good guy; around 5’11” with brown hair. Looking at him, I said, “Thanks, Leo.”

“No problem, Ally.” Hugging me, Leo said, “Just doing my job.”

Walking over, Dad looked at Leo and said, “How’d you know to come here, Leo?”

“Melissa knew that reporters would be interested in Ally; so she asked me to come here and make sure she was safe.”

We all talked for a few minutes, until it was time for Aaron and me to go inside for school. Hugging Leo again, I said, “Thanks again, Leo.”

“Anytime, Ally.”


Once inside the school, after making sure I was alright, Aaron went off to his locker. I noticed some people staring at me as I made my way through the halls; but that stopped when Patrick and Eric appeared next to me.

“We saw the reporters outside; are you okay?”

“Yeah, I’m fine.” Sighing, I said, “Leo came to my rescue.”


After talking for a few minutes, Patrick and Eric went off to their first classes. I was standing by my locker; trying to ignore the stares I was getting, when I saw 2 familiar faces walking towards me.

With a smile on my face, I turned to Sam and Kelly. “Hey guys.”

A grin on her face, Sam said, “First day of school; and you’re already popular with the news.”

Placing a hand on my shoulder, in a caring tone, Kelly said, “Are you alright?”

“Yeah, I’m fine.” Smiling, I said, “Thanks for asking.”

Kelly was about to say something else; when she was interrupted by her other friend Amber Riley. “What are you two doing talking to him?"

Amber’s been known to be outspoken in school; never one to keep her opinions to herself. Looking at her, I said, “I’m not a guy anymore, Amber; I’m a girl.”

“No you’re not; because you weren’t born a girl.” Glaring at me, Amber said, “You may have had an operation; but you’re still a guy.”

Before I could say anything, Kelly stood next to me and said. “What are you doing, Amber? Ally’s been through so much lately; she doesn’t need this.”

“You may be okay with her, Kelly. But,” chuckling, Amber said, “Sam and I don’t want to be seen with a freak.”

That went right through me; causing me to gasp in shock. I was about to say something in response, when Sam said, “Don’t bring me into this, Amber.” Standing next to me, Sam said, “Ally’s a girl just like us; and I’m going to help her adjust.”

“Are you serious?” shocked, Amber said, “You’re going to jeopardize our friendship for this?”

Glaring at Amber, Kelly said, “If you’re going to be like this, I think it’s time to reevaluate our friendship.”

With nothing left to say, Amber turned and walked away. Turning to Sam and Kelly, I said, “I appreciate the help guys; but I don’t want to destroy a friendship.”

“Oh please.” Grinning, Sam said, “If she’s going to act like that, I don’t want to be friends with her.”

Kelly nodded in agreement; saying, “We’ll help you through this, Ally.”

Blushing, I said, “Thanks guys.”
11111111111111111111111.title: The Next Day

111111111111111111111111.content:
After my altercation with Amber; I was glad to have Kelly and Sam on my side. As it turned out, the three of us had our first class of the day together.

Once I put some things into my locker, I followed Kelly and Sam through the halls to where our Chemistry class was. The three of us walked into the classroom; with everyone going quite when they realized that I was in the room.

The silence was deafening; as I found myself worried that everyone was going to react like Amber had. Imagine my surprise when they simply went back to what they were doing; as Kelly, Sam and I took our seats.

It was then that a couple classmates walked over. One of them, Kyle Rogers, was one of Aaron's friends.

“Hey Allison.” Looking at me, Kyle said, “Its...good to see you’re out of the hospital.”

“Thanks, Kyle.” Chuckling, I said, “It feels good to be out of there.”


The rest of the morning went by quickly; I had a few encounters with people who weren’t very accepting of my situation, but other than that it wasn’t that bad of a morning. Pretty soon it was lunch time, and I found myself heading to the lunch room with Kelly and Sam.

As we walked into the lunch room, I saw Patrick and Eric sitting at our usual table. Glancing at Sam and Kelly, I said, “I’ll be right back.”

Spotting me as I made my over, Eric said, “How’s your morning going, Ally?”

“Pretty good.” Shrugging, I said, “Did you hear what happened with Amber?”

“Yeah, we did.” Glancing at me, Patrick said, “Don’t let her get to you, Ally.”

“I’ll try not to, Pat.”

Gesturing to a chair, Eric said, “Care to join us?”

“Actually, I already told Kelly and Sam I’d eat with them.” Pausing, I said, “I hope you don’t mind.”

“It’s fine.” Smiling, Eric said, “We’ll see you later, Ally.”

The rest of the day was uneventful; although it was interesting being in the same math class as Aaron. I guess that would work well for him; as he was never good at math.

After the final bell rang, I grabbed my things and made my way outside. As I walked down the sidewalk, I saw Kelly walking towards me. She looked nervous about something. “What’s wrong, Kelly?”

“Come with me, Ally.” Taking my arm, Kelly said, “Sam spotted some reporters waiting in the junior parking lot; she’s getting her car and picking us up.”


After picking Aaron up; the four of us drove to my house. I’d invited Patrick and Eric over; but they both had to work. Once inside the house, Aaron locked the doors and turned to me. “Let me know if you guys need anything, alright?”

“Okay, Aaron.” Pausing, I said, “We will.”
111111111111111111111111.title: School

1111111111111111111111111.content:
Once we were in my room, I closed the door and sat down on the bed. Walking towards me, Sam said, “Let’s see how you fared at the mall.”

“What?” Shocked, I said, “I don’t recall you guys complaining about my outfit.”

“You’re wearing the jeans I picked out for you.” Chuckling, Kelly said, “That doesn’t count.”

“Let’s see one of the outfits your dad helped picked out.” Pulling me towards my closet, Sam said, “We want to see what your fashion sense is like.”

“Okay.” Blushing, I said, “You’ll understand if I want to change in the bathroom.”

“Just lay them out on the bed, silly.” Giggling, Kelly said, “We’ll be here all night if we have a fashion parade.”

Once I realized what they meant, I took the clothes out of the clothes and laid them on my bed. Kelly and Sam looked over my outfits before turning to me. “You’ve got a decent sense of clothes; but no sense of feminine style.”

Before I knew what they were doing, Kelly and Sam went to work on the clothes; mixing and matching them. I was surprised by the seven beautiful outfits on my bed; especially when I’d aimed more for ordinary.

Impressed with their work, Kelly turned to me and said, “See how little work is needed to liven up your wardrobe?”

“Yeah, those outfits look nice.” looking at them, chuckling, I said, “Thanks guys.”

“Why didn’t you buy any skirts, Ally?” Turning to me, Sam said, “Also, what’s with all the plain white panties; was that your dad’s idea of protecting you?”

"I'm not ready for all that frilly stuff yet." nervous, I replied. "I just became a girl a few days ago."

Looking at me, Kelly said, “What you need is a shopping experience with other girls.”

Walking over to me, Sam said, “You’re off to a good start; but you need a swimsuit, some skirts and shorts for the hot weather next week.”

“Okay.” Pausing, I said, “I-I guess that’s alright.”

Standing next to Sam, Kelly turned to me and said, “You’ll also need at least one dress.”

“No way!” shocked, I said, “That’s where I draw the line!”

“Come on, Ally.” Looking at me, Kelly said, “You’ll need to wear one at some point.”

I thought about that for a moment; before I finally said, “Fine; only if it’s not too girly.”

“Great.” Smiling, Kelly said, “We’ll take you to the mall this weekend.”

Managing to smile, I said, “Um...okay.”

Sam and Kelly began to giggle again; talking about how much I was going to enjoy going to the mall. I giggled along with them; although I wondered who was scarier, the reporters or Sam and Kelly talking about a trip to the mall.
1111111111111111111111111.title: Fashion Advice

11111111111111111111111111.content:
After Kelly and Sam stopped talking about taking me to the mall, I put in a movie for the three of us to watch. As we settled in to the watch the movie, I found myself surprised by how quickly I seemed to bond with Kelly and Sam.

I’d used to be friends with Kelly when her family had lived next door; Kelly used to hang out with me and Aaron a lot when we were younger. After she moved across town, the three of us went our separate ways; each of us finding new friends to hang out with.

It felt good to hang out with Kelly again; I just never figured I’d be a girl. Looking at them, I said, "I really appreciate that you guys would want to hang out with me."

"It's not a problem, Ally." chuckling, Kelly said, "You're dealing with a traumatic event; we're simply helping you."
11111111111111111111111111.title: Relaxing

111111111111111111111111111.content:
The rest of the evening was rather subdued; I wasn’t really in the mood for a big dinner, so dad just ordered pizza. After dinner was over, I followed Sam and Kelly back into the family room to watch TV.

As we sat down, Kelly turned to me and said, “Ally; I know just what you need to cheer yourself up.”

“Oh?” pausing, I said, “What’s that?”

Casting a quick glance at Sam, she said, “Your first girls’ slumber party.”

“What?” Shocked, I said, “I-I’m not ready for that.”

“Come on, Ally.” Looking at me, Kelly said, “Consider it practice for tomorrow.”

Tomorrow was my first gym class since the accident; meaning that I’d be in the girls’ locker room. “I-I’m not sure, guys; I don’t think I’m ready for that.”


Kelly was unusually persistent; eventually wearing me down to where I agreed to ask my dad. With them following behind me, I walked down the hall to the den. Seeing dad in the chair, I walked over and said, “Dad, would it be alright if...Kelly and Sam spent the night?”

Looking up at me, Dad said, “Are you sure?”

It didn’t take a genius to realize the real reason behind the question; he wanted to know if I was comfortable having Sam and Kelly sleeping in my room. I had to admit; I wasn’t entirely sure about it. I may be a girl like them; but I still had the mind of a boy.

Casting a glance to Sam and Kelly, I turned back to Dad and said, “I’m sure.”

“Okay.” Nodding, Dad said, “As long as it’s okay with their parents.”


It wasn’t long before Kelly and Sam’s parents dropped off some things for them; we soon found ourselves watching a movie in my room in our pajamas.
111111111111111111111111111.title: Continue

1111111111111111111111111111.content:
Walking into school the next morning, with Sam and Kelly following behind, I hoped that no one would bother me. That hope was shattered when I heard an angry voice say, “Now you’re trying to be one of us?”

Turning around, I saw Amber eying me with contempt. “What’s that, Amber?”

“Just because you’re wearing a skirt and make up; that doesn’t change the fact that you’re a freak.”

“Well, so much for that.”

With a sigh, I thought about the previous night. Sam and Kelly had both told me the same thing; minus the ‘freak’ part; when they tried to coax me into trying something more girly. Even though she said that I didn’t need much; I still refused to use make up.

I thought they’d dropped it; but that was until this morning. Kelly tried a different approach this time; by appealing to my ego. That explained why I was wearing a knee-length skirt and a hint of make up to school this morning.

I tried to hide my anger and frustration as Amber continued to mock me. Fortunately I saw Patrick walk into the school at that moment. One glare from him made Amber shut up. With a smirk, she looked at me and said, “See you in gym, freak.”

While I watched Amber walk off, I turned to look at Patrick. With a sympathetic tap on my shoulder, Patrick said, “Most of the guys are envious about what you’re going to do, Ally.”

I didn’t know how to react to that; losing my identity wasn’t worth even a cheap look at girls in their locker room. Looking at Patrick, I felt I had to give him an explanation. “Sam thought dressing like this would get people to back off.” Almost crying, I said, “Why won’t Amber back off?”

“Some people are jerks, Ally.” With a slight hesitation, Patrick pulled me in for a hug, “Don’t let her win; go in there and show that bitch who you are.”
1111111111111111111111111111.title: At School

11111111111111111111111111111.content:
My day went by uneventfully; with only a few encounters with Amber. With that being said, I did have a few encounters with other people who didn’t take too kindly to my new situation. I didn’t like how some of my former male classmates were hitting on me; I had to resist the urge to vomit on several occasions.

I wasn't sure if some of their attempts were genuine; or if they were simply trying to embarrass me. Either way; I didn't like the fact that boys now found me to be attractive.

Lunch went pretty much the same as yesterday; although Kelly surprised me by inviting Patrick and Eric to join us at the table. As I ate lunch with them, I started to notice a difference in the way Patrick and Eric acted around me. Whereas Patrick appeared to be uncomfortable around me, Eric was doing his best to be supportive.
11111111111111111111111111111.title: The Next Day

111111111111111111111111111111.content:
It wasn’t long before it was time for me to go to gym. I met Kelly and Sam outside the girls’ locker room. With a concerned look on her face, Kelly looked at me and said, “You ready for this, Ally?”

Sighing, I said, “As ready as I’ll ever be.”

Chuckling, Sam said, “You’ll do fine, Ally; we’ll be there with you.”

Walking into the locker room, I got a little unnerved when all the girls stopped talking and looked at me. Thankfully no one seemed hostile towards me; as I followed Kelly and Sam over to where our lockers were.

I took my time getting changed out of my skirt; considering how uncomfortable I was to be getting undressed around them. But with Kelly and Sam with me; I sucked it up and changed into my gym outfit...shorts, t-shirt and a sports bra.

Just then, as I was closing my locker, I heard someone say, “You’ve got a nice body for someone that was born a boy.”

Turning around, I saw Aubrey Mitchell standing behind me. Stepping in front of me, Sam said, “She had a better body than you when she was a boy.”

Although surprised to hear that; I didn’t say anything as Kelly and Sam came to my defense. Looking at me, with contempt, Aubrey said, “What’s that supposed to mean?”

With a smile on her face, Kelly said, “It means that you’ll have room to talk if you get some curves of your own.”

I couldn’t help but giggle along with Kelly and Sam as Aubrey walked off in frustration.
111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Locker Room

1111111111111111111111111111111.content:
After I’d calmed down, I followed Kelly and Sam into the gym. It wasn’t long before everyone else arrived; and the teacher told us that we were playing volleyball, boys versus girls.

As we the divided the class into teams; I noticed that several of my teammates didn’t seem too happy that I was on their team. As I took my spot on the court, I hoped that they’d come around eventually.


Thankfully they did come around; as we worked together as a team to beat the boys 6-3. That continued as we played against another team; beating them 6-4.

During a break in the games; I saw Kelly and Sam sitting on the bleachers as a boy came over to them. Recognizing him as Matt Collins; Kelly’s cousin, I walked over towards them.

I listened as Matt started talking to them. “I know you’re both trying to Allison; but don’t you think you should ease up a bit?”

“What do you mean, Matt?” confused, Kelly said, “She’s got to learn somehow.”

“Let’s say you woke up as a boy, Kelly.” Pausing, Matt said, “Would you like it if Eric and Patrick pushed you into going into the boy’s locker room before you were ready?”

Getting defensive, Sam said, “We asked if she was okay with it, Matt.”

“Yeah, but why didn’t you offer to let her change in one of the bathroom stalls?” sighing, Matt said, “I’m no expert; but rushing things will not help her.”

Making my presence known, slightly annoyed, I said, “I’m not a delicate flower, Matt.”

Surprised to hear me behind him, Matt turned and said, “You’re not a rock, either.” Pausing, Matt said, “Take things slowly, Allison; you don’t want to just jump in.”

“Something you know from experience?”

“I transferred here from another school when I was a freshman; and I jumped into the mix hoping that I’d be accepted. Only they gave me enough cold stares to give me a case of the flu.” Looking at me, Matt said, “Boys and girls are the biggest rivals in any school.”

“Yeah; but Kelly and Sam accepted me right away.”

“That’s because you’ve known them for years; the other girls need time to adjust to you being a girl.” With a gentile smile, Matt said, “Let the other girls come to you; it will work better that way.”
1111111111111111111111111111111.title: Gym Class

11111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Once school got out that day, I followed Kelly and Sam outside. As we walked towards the parking lot, I said, “You guys want to come over for a little while?”

“I’d love to, Ally. But,” glancing at me, Sam said, “I’ve got to be at work in 20 minutes.”

“Same here.” Pausing, Kelly said, “I’ve got work this afternoon; otherwise we’d both love to come over.”

“Okay.” Smiling, I said, “See you guys tomorrow.”

As I turned to walk away, Sam said, “Ally, you don’t think we’re ditching you. Right?”

“No, of course not.” Smiling, I said, “You guys have things to do; this gives me more time to spend with Aaron.”

“Good; because you know we’d never ditch you.”

Before they knew what I was doing, I turned and pulled both of them into a big hug. “I really appreciate everything you guys have done for me; you’re the best.”

“Hey.” Hugging me back, Kelly said, “That’s what friends are for, Ally.”

After breaking the hug, I said goodbye and walked to my car. As I got in, I thought about what Kelly had said. Did they really consider me to be a friend?
11111111111111111111111111111111.title: Later on

111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Pulling into the driveway, I saw someone standing on the front porch. Worried that it was some reporter; I was relieved when I saw it was Rachel.

Getting out of the car, I walked up to her. Looking at me, Rachel said, “How are you doing, Ally?”

“It’s been better; girls at school are treating me like a freak and Dr. Parker’s making my life hell.” sighing, I said, "He hasn't stopped bugging me about his offer since I left the hospital."

There was a hint of outrage in Rachel’s voice as she said, “There’s got to be some people treating you alright.”

“Most of my friends from before are sticking with me.” Taking a breath, I said, “Plus two girls from school are really great.”

Looking at my outfit, Rachel said, “I take it they were the ones who talked you into a skirt?”

“Yeah, I let them talk me into it.” With a weak smile, I said, “Don’t tell Aaron; but it’s not as bad as I thought it would be.”


We talked for a little while longer; I decided not to tell Rachel about my making out with Kelly. Looking at me, Rachel said, “Seems like you’ve done pretty well for yourself.”

Tearing up, I said, “But it just takes a few jerks to ruin everything.”

“You’ll get through this, Ally.” Placing a hand on my shoulder, Rachel said, “We’re all here for you.”

Rachel left a short time later; after making sure that I was going to be alright. Once she was gone, I walked into the house and closed the door. My phone rang as I walked up to my room; it was a text from Aaron saying that he’s going to be home in a few minutes.
111111111111111111111111111111111.title: At Home

1111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I was in the kitchen, making a snack, when Aaron came home a short time later. “Ally, I’m home.” Walking into the kitchen, Aaron said, “Why are you still wearing the skirt?”

“I haven’t gotten around to changing yet.” Pausing, I said, “Is that alright with you?”

“Yeah, that’s alright.” Sounding relieved, Aaron said, “I thought you were beginning to enjoy it.”

“You have no idea.” Looking at Aaron, I said, “If you don’t mind; I’m going to get changed now.”


I came down a short time later; wearing shorts and a top. I found Aaron watching TV in the family room; probably because it was pouring outside. Walking into the room, I said, “Mind if I join you?”

“Sure.” Moving over, Aaron said, “Have a seat.”

Sitting down, I said, “It didn’t seem like you were too happy about me wearing a skirt.”

“It’s not that I wasn’t happy.” Pausing, Aaron said, “It’s just that I thought you were going to be a tomboy.”

“Sam and Kelly talked me into it, Aaron.” Leaning back, I said, “But even tomboys wear skirts on occasion

“So...this isn’t going to be an everyday thing?” sounding hopeful, Aaron said, “Just every now and then?”

“Yeah.” Chuckling, I said, “Don’t worry, I’m not going to go girly overnight.”

“That’s good to hear.”


The two of us watched TV for a while; until we got bored. As Aaron turned to leave, I said, “Why does it seem like you’re avoiding me, Aaron?”
“I’m not avoiding you, Ally.” Pausing, Aaron said, “It’s just that seeing you like this...makes me think.”

Suddenly confused, I said, “About what?”

Looking at me, Aaron said, “About how it could’ve been me running after that ball.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Spending time with Aaron

11111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
As I got ready for sleep that night, I found myself thinking about what Aaron said; what if he’d been hit by the car instead of me.

Once I finally fell asleep, I found myself back in the driveway on the day of the accident. Like the last time, Aaron and I were leading 10-7.

With the ball in hand, I threw it and missed the hoop. I watched as the ball rolled down the driveway; running after it as I saw Aaron out of the corner of my eye. Before I knew what was happening, Aaron had pushed me out of the way and stumbled into the street. The next thing I knew; I saw Aaron take a direct hit by the truck.

“No!” crying out in my sleep, I whispered. “Aaron!”

I wanted to run out to my little brother but I was powerless to move from my place on the sidewalk and could only watch in horror as a pool of blood formed under the truck’s front wheel.

Before I could scream out in my sleep, the dream shifted to me looking at Aaron as he lay in a coma at the hospital. Only he no longer looked like Aaron; the surgeons had made him into a girl.

Looking at dad, I said, “Why?”

“His pelvic region was completely crushed, Brian.” Holding back tears, Dad said, “He didn’t have long to live...I was desperate.”


I was sweating by this time, tossing and turning on the bed as I whispered, “No! This is wrong! That should be me, not you, Aaron!”

The dream soon shifted to where I was standing by the bed as...Nora was told about the news. Nora completely fell apart; just as I had. I wanted to pull her into a hug but didn’t know if it would help. Dad pulled me out of the room as I cried in my sleep. The dream shifted again; to Nora leaving the hospital.

The moment we got out of the hospital; we were bombarded by dozens of reporters, all of them wanting to ask Nora questions. We eventually made it to the car; with the reporters hounding us the entire time.

Nora was already crying at this point, begging to be left alone as we pulled out of the parking lot. “Sorry about that, Nora.” Glancing at her, Dad said, “It’s been all over the news since that doctor went to the papers.”

Still crying, Nora placed her head on my shoulder. “What am I going to do, big brother?”

Knowing that Nora was frightened and confused, I hesitantly pulled her into a hug. “It’s going to be okay...sis.” holding her, I said, “We’ll work this out.”


It was then that I woke up; finding myself in tears. For a moment, I did not know where I was and began to call for Nora. A moment later, I regained my grip on reality but still found myself shaken by the dream.
11111111111111111111111111111111111.title: What If?

111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Once I figured out where I was, and that I was safe, I got out of bed. Walking to the bathroom, still shaken from the dream, I splashed some cold water on my face.

Staring at my reflection in the mirror, I said to myself, “That was one freaky dream; now I know a little of what Aaron’s going through.”


After composing myself, I decided to go to the kitchen to get a midnight snack. With a glass of milk and a piece of bread, I sat down at the kitchen table.

I was taking a bite of the bread, when I heard footsteps in the hallway. I looked up to see Aaron shuffling into the room; looking as if he was half asleep.

Walking over to the table, Aaron looked at me and said, “Can’t sleep?”

Taking a breath, I said, “I-I had a rather disturbing dream; I’d rather not go back to sleep for a while.”

Looking at me, Aaron said, “What was the dream about?”

“You got hit by the truck instead of me; you became a girl instead of me.” Sighing, I said, “I-I felt like I had no idea what I could do for you.”

“I feel the same way, Ally.” Pausing, Aaron said, “When we were younger, we always had each other’s backs. But now that you’re a girl; it’s like we never hang out anymore.”

“So that’s what’s bothering him.” Looking at Aaron, I said, “Just because I’m a girl doesn’t mean we won’t spend time together.”

“You say that now. But,” sighing, Aaron said, “It’s hard to believe you when you’ve all your free time with Kelly and Sam.”

“They’re helping me adjust, Aaron.” Pausing, I said, “They’re also the only girls who’ve gone out of their way to help me.”

“I know that; and I can understand why you’d want to spend time with them.” Placing a hand on my shoulder, Aaron said, “Just don’t forget that you’ve got other people who care about you.”

Realizing that Aaron was right, I looked at him and said, “I’ll tell you what; after school...today, we can all hang out together at the mall or something. The 6 of us will spend the afternoon together.”


Aaron and I talked for a little while longer; until we both started to feel tired again. After saying good night, we both went back to our rooms.
111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Midnight Snack

1111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
My school day went by uneventfully; with no encounters with Aubrey or Amber. I actually felt like people were starting to accept me. That was until school ended for the day.

I was going to my locker to grab my things before heading to the mall with the others. I’d told them that I’d meet them there; with Kelly riding with Sam and Eric giving Aaron and Patrick a ride.

I’d just finished grabbing my things and was heading to the door, when Aubrey appeared in front of me. “Where do you think you’re going, freak?”

“Going to the mall with my friends.” Realizing that I was being surrounded, I said, “Got a problem with that?”

“Yes, as a matter of fact.” Stepping closer, Aubrey said, “You’re not going to the mall.”

Before I knew what was happening, I was dragged into the nearby girls’ room. I was unable to do anything as Aubrey and another girl shoved me into a stall. Forcing me onto the toilet, Aubrey grabbed a bag from another girl and pulled out a rather feminine looking outfit.

“What are you doing, Aubrey?”

Looking at me, Aubrey said, “If you want to be a girl; you should dress like one.”

I was powerless to escape as Aubrey spent the next 20 minutes giving me an unwanted makeover. When she was finished, she shoved me in front of the mirror. I was shocked to see that I was now wearing a feminine skirt with matching top and a pair of heels. I even had make up on.

Turning to Aubrey, I said, “Why are you doing this?”

“To show everyone how much of a girl you really are.”

I thought everything was done; until I was pulled out of the bathroom and led down the hall. Before I knew it; I was being shoved into the girls’ locker room. Closing the door behind me, Aubrey said, “Have fun, Allison.”

Stumbling in the heels, I looked up to find that I’d been shoved into the locker room just as the cheer squad was getting changed. Fearing the worst, I was about to start crying when one of the girls walked forward. I recognized her as Caitlyn Fitzpatrick; a former classmate of mine.

Looking at me, she said, “Let me guess; Aubrey did this to you?”

“Yeah, she did.” Tearing up, I said, “You don’t think I’d wear this willingly, do you?”

“Of course not, Allison.” Gesturing me to sit down, Caitlyn said, “We all know how mean Aubrey can be.”


I was pleasantly surprised by how kind the cheerleaders were; they retrieved my clothes and helped me get changed. Once I was back in my original outfit, I said, “Thanks guys.”

As I turned to leave, Caitlyn came over to me and said, “Don’t take this the wrong way, Allison. But,” pausing, she said, “You’ve got the perfect body for a cheerleader.”

“I’m barely used to being a girl.” Chuckling, I said, “I don’t think I’m ready for that just yet.”

“Keep it in mind, okay?” smiling, Caitlyn said, “In the mean time; the squads got your back.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: At School

11111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I got to the mall a short time later; still thinking about my encounter with Aubrey as I made my way to the food court. Spotting the others sitting at a table, I walked over to them. As I got closer, I could tell that Aaron was being rather shy around Kelly.

It was then that Patrick saw me. “There you are! What took you so long?”

I told them what happened with Aubrey; all of them were shocked. Looking at me, Sam said, “I knew Aubrey didn’t like you; but I didn’t expect her to do this.”

“You know what you need, Ally?” smiling, Kelly said, “A relaxing afternoon of shopping at the mall.”

“What?” confused, I said, “I thought we were doing that tomorrow.”

“Trust me; you need this.”


After we all had something to eat, we got up and started to go shopping. I was surprised when Aaron, Patrick, and Eric decided to hang around; but they said they wanted to be supportive of me.

Expecting to be led into the girl’s section, I was surprised to find myself in the guy’s section. “What are we doing here?” pausing, I said, “You do know I’m a girl now.”

“So.” Chuckling, Kelly said, “Do you know how many girls wear boy’s shirts?”

“What’s that have to do with me?”

With a smile on her face, Sam said, “This is the best place for you to start making your new look; with something you’re familiar with.”

It was then that Eric came over holding a shirt in his arms. “I found this in the girl’s section; I thought it was appropriate.”
