Looking at the shirt, which said ‘Tough Princess’ on the front, I blushed and said, “Sorry Eric; that’s not my style.”

It was then that Kelly handed me a shirt; which said ‘What Are You Looking At?’ Smiling, Kelly said, “How about this one?”

Chuckling, I said, “That’s a good one.”


With the shirt in hand, I went into a nearby changing room. After putting the shirt on, I went back outside to get an opinion. The minute I walked over to the group, Eric and Patrick started to chuckle.

Looking at them, I said, “What’s so funny?”

Still chuckling, Eric pointed to my shirt. “Take a look.”

Turning to a nearby mirror, I saw why they were laughing. Because the shirt wasn’t made for my new body and figure, ‘What Are You Looking At?’ was positioned over my chest. I couldn’t help but start laughing at that; the first genuine laugh I’ve had since waking up.

With a smile on my face, I said, “I think I like this shirt.”


After that humorous moment, I changed back into my other shirt and joined the others. Once that was done, we picked out some other shirts before moving onto the girl’s clothing section. We spent some time in there; picking out some more skirts and, to my embarrassment, a few dresses and bikinis.

It was during that time I realized how awkward this must be for the guys. After discussing it with Kelly and Sam; we each picked out the least feminine shirt for them to try on, so they’d feel involved. They were mortified at first; but relaxed when they saw that I was laughing again. To make them feel better, I even decided to buy the shirts for myself.

We spent over 2 hours at the mall by time we finally left; as we left, I found myself admitting that it made me feel better after what’s been happening at school. As we walked to where we’d all parked, Kelly said, “You guys feel up to some pool time?”

“Sure,” pausing, Eric said, “Where?”

“I’ve got a pool at my house; how about we all meet there in a little while to relax.”

“I don’t know, Kelly.” Pausing, I said, “I’m not ready for that.”

Looking at me, Kelly said, “Come on, Ally; you need this.”

“Okay.” Realizing that I wasn’t getting out of this, I said, “Fine, I’ll do it.”


With that, we all agreed to meet at Kelly’s house in 45 minutes. After taking a bathing suit from the bag, I asked Aaron to bring the rest of the clothes to my room once he got home.
11111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: At the mall

111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Kelly and I were the first ones to arrive at her house; which came as no surprise since she drove with me. As we walked inside, I turned to her and said, “I’m having second thoughts about this, Kelly.”

“Come on, Ally.” Looking at me, Kelly said, “You’ve got to do this sooner or later.”

“I know that.” Pausing, I said, “It’s just...weird.”

“We’re all friends here, Ally.” Smiling, Kelly said, “It’s not like we’re strangers.”


It took another few minutes, but Kelly eventually persuaded me to try on the bikini. While she got changed in her bedroom, I went into her bathroom to change. After changing into the bikini, I looked at the mirror and saw that I didn’t look all that bad. While I still wasn’t used to having a figure, the bikini did a good job of showing it off.

Composing myself, I walked back to Kelly’s room just as she’d finished getting changed.

Looking at me, blushing, Kelly said, “You look amazing in that, Ally.”

“You look great too, Kel.” Blushing, I said, “But we’re hardly wearing anything; I feel so...vulnerable.”

“It’s not like we’re going to the beach, Ally.” Placing a hand on my shoulder, Kelly said, “We’re just going to my backyard.”

“What about the guys?” pausing, I said, “How do you think they’ll react?”

“I’m sure Eric and Patrick will be surprised by how attractive it makes you look; but I don’t think they’ll see you any differently.” Pausing, Kelly said, “Aaron’s going to be surprised though; deep down I think he still sees you as his older brother.”

“I don’t know, Kelly.” Sighing, I said, “I-I guess I’m just a little scared.”

Moving closer, a smile on her face, Kelly said, “Let me help you with that.”

Suddenly Kelly kissed me on the lips; followed by me kissing her back. It wasn’t long before we were making out in Kelly’s bedroom, oblivious to the fact that the front door had just opened.

We were still kissing when Kelly’s bedroom door opened; followed by Sam saying. “Whoa!! What’s going on here?”

Startled, I broke the kiss and stepped away from Kelly. Looking at Sam, blushing, I said, “H-Hey Sam; w-we didn’t hear you come in.”

“I can see why.” Shocked, Sam said, “Is there something going on that I should know about?”

Standing next to me, Kelly said, “We’re just experimenting, Sam; it’s normal for girls our age.”

“Are you sure about that, Kelly?” Glancing at Kelly, Sam said, “Are you really sure that’s the reason?”

Turning pale, Kelly said, “Sam, please...”

Casting a quick glance to me, Sam turned back to Kelly and said, “We both know you had feelings for Brian and Aaron.” Sternly, Sam said, “You didn’t act upon those feelings because you didn’t want to divide them.”

Surprised by that, I turned to Kelly and said, “Y-You had feelings for me and Aaron?”

Seemingly ignoring me, getting defensive, Kelly said, “Brian woke up as a girl; she’s going through so much.” Sighing, Kelly said, “She called me, needing support, and one thing turned to another...it just happened.”

“This is just as much my fault, Sam.” Stepping next to Kelly, I said, “I didn’t push her away.”

“If Aaron ever sees the two of you experimenting you’ll both break his heart. Everyone knows that he’s got feelings for you; only he’s too shy to admit it.” Turning to me, sighing, Sam said, “Ally, if you continue down this road with Kelly; it will be hard for you to stop if you decide this isn’t for you. You’ll risk breaking her heart.”

Glancing at me, Kelly said, “What do you want us to do, Sam?”

“Search your hearts deeply; both of you.” Placing hands on our shoulders, Sam said, “If you both feel this is want you want; then go for it. If not; then stop before you destroy your friendship.”

Kelly and I were silently for a few moments; both of us thinking. I was the first to speak. “Kelly, I-I think we need to stop.” Sighing, I said, “Aaron’s my little brother; I don’t want to hurt him.”

It looked as if Kelly was going to protest; when she said, “You’re right.” Turning to me, Kelly said, “I-I guess I was hoping that my feelings for you wouldn’t change now that you’re a girl.”

“I wish you would’ve told me you had feelings for me.” Turning to Kelly, I said, “You’re quite the good kisser, Kelly.”

Chuckling, looking at me, Kelly said, “You’re not too bad yourself, Ally.”

Looking at the two of us, Sam said, “Are you to going to be alright?”

Smiling, I said, “Yeah, we’ll be fine.”


After grabbing some towels, the three of us walked downstairs to go outside. As we walked through the kitchen, I saw Aaron and the others standing in the pool. Taking a deep breath, I walked out onto the deck. All of three of them went silent as they noticed me.

Blushing, I said, “How do I look, guys?”
111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: At Kelly's House

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
All three guys stopped what they were doing and simply stared at me with their mouths open. I knew them well enough to know what they were thinking; that they should check out the attractive girl standing in front of them.

I wasn’t surprised when, as Kelly had said, Patrick and Eric quickly forced a smile onto their faces as they started to act like a couple of idiots.
Starting to blush, Eric said, “Stop checking her out, Pat! That’s Ally.”

“You’re the one checking her out!” punching Eric in the arm, Pat said, “Knock it off!”


Like I said; they were acting like a couple of idiots. It actually made me feel comfortable around them; seeing them behaving normally. At that point, I turned to Aaron and saw that he was blushing worse than me. I couldn’t blame him; since I’d do the same thing if he was the one in the bikini.

“Kelly’s right; he still sees me as his brother.”

I didn’t want him to feel awkward around me; especially as I hoped Pat and Eric wouldn’t ask me what it’s like in a bikini. It was then I realized he was in the perfect position.

Walking up to him, I said, “I’m still me, bro.”

Before he could respond, I gave him a slight nudge into the pool. Breaking the surface, he looked at me and said, “Ally!!”

I stepped away from the edge; afraid that he’d pull me into the pool. I failed to notice Sam and Kelly sneaking up behind me. Before I knew what happened, they pushed me into the pool. I surfaced next to Aaron as he started laughing. It wasn’t long before we were all laughing; having a good time in each other’s company.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Reactions

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Spending time in Kelly’s pool was by far the most relaxing thing I’d done since leaving the hospital; it was nice to spend time with everyone. As I floated on a pool chair, I saw how easily everyone seemed to get along with each other; especially Sam and Eric.

Wearing a bikini in the pool was an interesting experience; nothing like wearing a boy’s bathing suit. On top of that; it felt weird swimming and feeling the water move around my chest. It reminded me how sensitive my body was now; especially when it came to swimming or taking a shower.

I was floating aimlessly in the pool, relaxing and soaking in the sun, when I saw Patrick swimming over to me. Looking at him, I said, “Hey Pat, what’s up?”

“Nothing much.” Pausing, he said, “I-I was just wondering how you’re doing.”

“Oh, let’s see.” Shrugging, I said, “I get hit by a truck and wake up a girl; all things considered, I’ve been better.”

“For what it’s worth, you look good in the bikini.” Blushing, Patrick said, “W-What’s it like to wear one?”

“It feels like I’m barely wearing anything.” Blushing, I said, “I feel...vulnerable.”

Patrick and I talked for a little while longer; although it was clear that Patrick was hiding something from me. I knew how stubborn he could be, so I decided not to push him. We all spent a little while longer at Kelly’s house before we decided it was time to leave.

What came next was a surprise to me; Kelly had asked if Eric would take a picture of us girls. Once that was done; we took two more pictures; one with me and the guys and one with everyone.


After getting dressed in the bathroom, I walked to the stairs just as Aaron and Kelly were finishing a conversation. I watched as Aaron walked away; leaving a frustrated Kelly standing by the door.

Concerned, I walked down to her and said, “Kel, what’s wrong?”

“No offense, Ally; but your brother drives me crazy sometimes.” Sighing, Kelly turned to me and said, “When it seems like he wants to say something to me; he’s either too shy or can’t stop shaking when he’s near me.”

“He gets like that when he’s not sure how someone will react.” Sighing, I said, “He was like that with me after I got out of the hospital.”

Shaking her head in frustration, Kelly said, “He knows I don’t bite, right?”

Chuckling, in a teasing tone, I said, “Maybe he’s got a crush on you.”

“H-Him having a cr-crush on me?” giving a nervous giggle, Kelly said, “He-He’s too immature for me; no offense, Ally.”

“None taken.” Shrugging my shoulders, I said, “I know from experience that he can be immature at times.”

“W-What should I do?”

“You could always ask him out.”

“What?” shocked, Kelly said, “I-I can’t ask him out.”

“Why can’t you ask him out, Kelly?” smiling, I said, “It’s the 21st century; girls ask boys out all the time.”

“You know what.” Steeling herself, Kelly said, “I-I’ll ask him out.”


I watched from the car as Kelly talked to Aaron. I wasn’t able to hear them; but I knew things went well when both Kelly and Aaron smiled. Kelly looked at me with a smile on her face; as Aaron got into the car.

Looking at me, as I pulled out of Kelly’s driveway, Aaron said, “Thank you, sis.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Hanging Out

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I headed to my room immediately after Aaron and I got home; since I needed some time to myself. Closing the door, I immediately stripped down to my bra and panties. I don’t know why I did that; considering I had no interest in exploring, as one insensitive jerk at school had suggested.

I wanted to lie down in bed; my mind telling me that I was tired from swimming. Aside from gym class, that was the first real exercise I’ve had since the hospital. It was certainly the most enjoyable; getting to relax with my friends in the privacy of a backyard.

I turned to grab my laptop; when I noticed my reflection in my mirror, my hair flowing down over one shoulder. It was at that moment that I found the answer to a question I’d been asking myself since I woke up; “Yes, I can live like this.”

Grabbing my laptop, I turned it on and walked back to bed. I was about to sit down when I heard a ringing coming from it; someone was calling me on Skype. Seeing that it was Melissa, I quickly decided to put on some pajamas before answering the call.

Once that was done, I lay down in bed and answered the call. I was immediately greeted by Melissa with a big smile on her face. “Hey cuz, how was your day?”

“Hey Mel.” Smiling, I said, “It was fun, I spent some time at a friend’s pool.”

“Really?” grinning, Melissa said, “Did you wear a bikini?”

“Yes.” Blushing, I said, “I did.”

“How did it feel?”

“I felt a little vulnerable; but it wasn’t as bad as I’d expected.”


The two of us talked for a while before Dad called me down for dinner. After ending the video call, I turned off the laptop and went downstairs.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Relaxing

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I fell asleep the moment I hit the pillow that night; physically exhausted from hanging out with the others. I soon dreamt about returning home to find the place empty.

Walking into the house, I took off my shoes as I caught a whiff of freshly baked bread. “That’s weird; I didn’t see dad’s car in the drive, and since when does he bake?”

Continuing towards the kitchen, I froze when I saw...mom standing by the oven with a freshly baked loaf of bread in hands.

She must’ve sensed I was in the room; as she turned to me and said, “Ally, what’s wrong?”

Stunned, with tears streaming down my face, I said, “M-Mom!?”

I started to toss and turn in bed; as tears started to flow.

“It’s okay, sweetie.” Nodding, Mom said, “I’m always with you.”

Hugging mom, crying, I said, “I-If only yo-you knew wh-what’s been happ-happening to me!”

“I know, sweetie.” Stroking my hair, Mom said, “Your whole life’s been turned upside down; and you simply want things to get back to normal.”

Sobbing, I said, “How can I do that?”

“Nothing will ever change the fact that you’ll always be your father and my child.” Looking into my eyes, Mom said, “You’re still the same person inside; no extra and missing part will ever change that.”

“It’s just been...difficult.”

“You’ve become a girl and you’re not sure how to cope.” Looking at me, Mom said, “Would you want some advice?”

“Of course, mom.”

“Don’t force anything or allow anything to be forced on you.” Pausing, Mom said, “When you’re ready to try on a dress or use makeup; you’ll know where to find them.”

It was then that I woke up in tears; finding myself hugging my pillow tightly. Wiping the tears from my face, I said, “Thanks, mom.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: That Night

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I came downstairs the next morning to find that Dad was making some eggs for breakfast. “You okay, sweetie?” looking at me, Dad, “Looks like you’ve been crying.”

“I was; I-I had a dream about mom last night.”

I told him about the dream; when I finished, Dad said, “You were always close with your mother; it’s not surprising that your subconscious would reach for her given what you’ve gone through recently.”

“What about the whole dress and makeup thing?”

Digging into his wallet, Dad handed me $150 and said, “Go to the mall and see where your heart leads you, honey.”


I got to the mall a short time later; parking my car in the lot before walking inside. With Kelly preoccupied with getting ready for her date with Aaron tonight, and Sam spending time with Eric, this was the first time I’d gone to the mall by myself.

I soon found myself outside of JcPenny’s; hesitant to go inside because I felt like I was entering an alien environment. Gathering my courage, I walked inside and started to look at the clothes. I was walking through the aisles when I spotted a mannequin wearing a dress (http://www.jcpenney.com/dotcom/juniors-g...¤tTabCatId=®Id=).

It wasn’t so much that I wanted to wear the dress; it simply reminded me of something mom liked to wear. I was so focused on the dress; that I failed to notice the salesgirl walking up to me. “Like the dress?”

Turning to look at her; I guessed that she was a few years older than Melissa, maybe late 20s. “I-I’m not sure; you might say I’m a bit of a tomboy.” Pausing, I said, “I usually don’t wear dresses.”

“Why not give it a try?” Smiling, she said, “I loved wearing dresses at your age; and I didn’t have your figure.”

Smiling at the compliment, I said, “I find that hard to believe; you look great.”

“Thanks; I look great now.” Pausing, the girl said, “Back then I used to be a boy; just like you.”

“You know about me!?” shocked, I said, “You used to be a boy?”

“Yeah; only I didn’t get my sex change because of an accident, I also didn’t get the same procedure as you.” Pausing, she said, “In fact, I’m a little envious.”

I was surprised to hear that. I knew that I had a nice figure, and a lot of people told me that I was pretty. This was the first time, however, that someone said, she was jealous of me.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Next Day

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Blushing, I said, “I-I don’t know what to say.”

The salesclerk smiled before she took a dress of the rack; identical to one on display Holding it in front of me, she said, “You’re definitely a petite.” Looking at me, she said, “I’ll tell you what; I’ll let you use my employee discount if you buy the dress.”

“I-I don’t know.” Blushing, I said, “I don’t think I’m ready to wear a dress.”

“I’m not asking you to wear it right away; only that you think about.” Pausing, she said, “I’ll throw in a few accessories for free to sweeten the deal.”

This salesclerk, who I’d just met, was so willing to help me. Looking at her, I had to ask, “What’s the catch?”

“I had a rough transition when I went from boy to girl; even if mine was by choice, I stil had problems fitting in.” Looking at me, she said, “This dress will look great on you, when you’re ready for it. Consider it my way of helping out.”

I was happy to learn that there was someone who had some idea of what I was dealing with. “I’ll buy it; but I’m not making promises about wearing it any time soon.” Taking the dress, I said, “You said something about accessories?”

“Oh, right; the dress comes with a matching light jacket.” With a smirk, she said, “Sold separately of course.”

Chuckling, I said, “Of course.”

“Every dress has to have to the proper shoes to go along with it.” Looking at me, as she picked out the items, she said, “You’re going to knock them dead with this outfit.”

“Thanks,” smiling, I said “You’re one hell of a salesclerk.”

Smiling, she said, “Thank you.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The dress (and accessories)

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
After talking with the clerk, who’s named I learned was Michelle Riley, I grabbed my things and decided it was time to go home.

I got home a short time later; grabbing my things, I went inside the house. Walking into my room, I placed the bags by my desk just as Aaron knocked on my door. “Hey Ally, can I come in?”

“Sure.” Praying he didn’t see the dress, I said, “Come on in.”

As he came into the room, I saw that he was holding a wrapped package. Seeing the look on my face, he said, “I got you a little something; as thanks for talking Kelly into asking me out.”

Taking the package and unwrapping it, I said, “You’re my little brother, Aaron; you didn’t have to get me anything.”

“Of course I did; I wanted to show that I support you.”

By that point, I’d finished unwrapping the package to find a diary. Tearing up, I turned to Aaron and said, “Aaron...thank you!”

Hugging me, Aaron said, “I’ve seen how much you’ve been writing lately; so I thought you could use something to collect your thoughts.

Composing myself, I said, “I’ll start using it right away.”

Smiling, weakly, Aaron said, “I’ll leave you alone now.”

As Aaron turned to leave, having sensed something, I said, “This must be really difficult for you, Aaron; me becoming a girl.” Sighing, I said, “I’m always here if you want to talk”

“I-I was so afraid after the accident; wondering if you were going to survive.” Turning to me, tearing up, Aaron said, “Then dad said they’d be making you into a girl; I didn’t know how to handle it.”

“I may be a girl now. But,” gesturing towards me head, I said, “I’m still a guy up here.”

Even as I said that, I thought back to how I’d just purchased a rather feminine dress. Looking at me, Aaron said, “That’s good to hear.” Pausing, Aaron said, “After seeing you in the bikini, I was worried you were starting to think like a girl.”

Aaron left a moment later; leaving me standing in the middle of my room. Aaron’s words echoed in my ears; making me wonder if I was starting to think like a girl.


The rest of the day passed by uneventfully; save for Sam calling to tell me that Eric had asked her out on a date. I spent the afternoon indoors due to rain; which gave me time to watch some Netflix. After a nice dinner with Aaron and Dad, I went to bed around 8:30.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Going Home

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I woke up the next day to hear Aaron and Dad talking out in the hall; Aaron was asking Dad if he could go to a friend’s house to build a tree house. I’d heard about that project; and I wasn’t surprised when dad said Aaron could go.

Rolling out of bed, I heard the front door close; meaning that Aaron had just left. “Guess that means it’s just me and dad; wonder what he’s got planned.”

Just then, the phone rang and I heard Dad answer it. Focusing on getting dressed, I didn’t pay attention to the conversation. A few minutes later, there was knock on my door. “Ally, honey...are you dressed?”

“Yeah; come on in.”

Dad opened the door; looking concerned. “I hate to do this, Ally; but I just got called into work.”

“I’ll be fine, dad.” Smiling, I said, “I’m a big girl.”

“It’s still weird hearing that from you.” Looking at me, dad said, “Are you sure you’ll be okay?”

“Boy or girl, I’m not a kid anymore.” Patiently, I said, “I’ll see you when you get back.”

“Thanks, sweetie.” Kissing my forehead, he said, “I’ll be back as soon as I can.”


Once dad left; I went to the bathroom before returning to my room. As I closed the door, I found myself looking at the closet. My mom’s words echoed in my head; as I eyed the dress hanging in the closet.

“I’m home alone for the day; who’s going to see me?” a smile forming, I said, “Maybe now’s the right time.”

I started to feel both excited and uncertain as I grabbed the dress from the hook. This was a new experience for me; and I wondered if I should wear pantyhose with it. I decided against that; in the event that I had to get undressed quickly.

Realizing I wouldn’t get another opportunity like this for a while, I placed the dress on my bed before getting undressed. Taking a deep breath, I picked up the dress and slipped into it. Once I was all set; with the dress zipped up. I looked at the mirror. “It’s a perfect fit; it seems to hug every curve.” Smiling, as I pulled my hair back, I said, “I like it.”

It was then that I spotted Kelly’s travel makeup kit on my vanity; realizing that I’d gone this far, I decided to go to the next step.
Believing that I had the entire day, I took my time as I made certain to do a good job with the makeup.

Looking at the mirror, seeing my handiwork, I had to admit it wasn’t bad for my first time.

Slipping into a pair of three inch heels that I’d gotten with the dress, I realized I had to see the complete look.


After getting the hang of walking in heels, with butterflies in my stomach, I slowly walked down the hall to dad’s bedroom. Going
up to a mirror that my mom had used, I was astonished by what I saw. I rose a hand to my mouth in shock; smiling at my reflection. “I can’t believe that’s me; Kelly and Sam would faint in they saw me right now.”

I was so caught up in my reflection; that I failed to hear the front door close, with dad’s footstep coming up the stairs. Had I been paying attention, I would’ve noticed his shocked look in the mirror before he docked around the corner.
“I can get used to this; at least every now and then.”

Walking out of dad’s bedroom, I bumped into dad in the hallway. “Dad!” shocked, I said, “I-I didn’t think you’d be home so soon.”

I was blushing so brightly, feeling as if I’d been caught with my hand in the cookie jar. I was tempted to run to my room, tears streaming down my cheeks, when Dad lightly touched my shoulder and said, “You look so much like your mother, sweetheart.”

“What!?” shocked, I said, “Yo-You’re not upset?”

“Why would I be upset; you’re a girl now.” Looking at me, softly, Dad said, “It’s only natural for you to wear a dress.”

“Thanks Dad.” Wiping tears, I said, “I-I’m going to get changed now; before Aaron comes home.”

“Before you do that; let me grab the camera and snap some photos.” Looking at me, Dad said, “I want to remember this moment.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Next Day

choices: Later On (Aaron Returns from the date)
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Despite worrying that Aaron would show up at any moment; I allowed dad to take a few pictures of me in the dress. I realized this was as much for him as it was for me; as he'd never had a daughter before and wanted to chronicle every big moment as I adjusted.

We took several photos; including one of the two of us; before dad let me get changed into something more casual.

I had to admit that wearing a dress wasn't as bad as I'd originally thought; it actually felt nice to see how it showed off my curves. After changing into something more casual, I went to the bathroom to clean off my makeup.

Once that was finished, I went back to my room just as Aaron walked in through the front door. Looking at him, I saw a smile on his face. With his date with Kelly scheduled for tonight; I'd be surprised if he wasn't anxious or smiling.

We talked for a few minutes; before I went to my room to work on some homework.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Continue

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The evening passed by slowly after Aaron left for his date with Kelly; dad and I passed the time by watching movies together. Although I could tell he was still uneasy around me, it was nice to see that dad was at least trying to spend time with me now that I was a girl.

It was getting late by time the movie ended; and Dad said it was time to get ready for bed. I was lying on my bed, reading a book, when he walked in a short time later. "Aren't you going to bed, Allison?"

"I'm not going to bed yet, dad." Looking at Dad, I said, "I want to wait for Aaron to come home."

"Okay, sweetie." Kissing me on the forehead, Dad said, "I'll see you in the morning."


Aaron came home a short time later; walking down the hall with a smile on his face. Hearing him, I peered out of my door and said, "How was the date, bro?"

"It was great." Looking at me, Aaron said, "We had a bite to eat before going bowling."

"I'm glad to hear it."

Hugging me, Aaron said, "Thanks for convincing Kelly to ask me out, sis."

"You're welcome, Aaron." Hugging him back, I said, "You're my little brother; and I wanted you to be happy."

Looking at me, with a grin on his face, "Maybe I can return the favor by setting you up with one of my friends."

"Thanks; but I'll have to decline." Pausing, I said, "I've got a lot of adjusting to do before I consider dating."

"I understand." Turning towards his room, Aaron said, "For what it's worth; I'm sure you'll make a great girlfriend."


As I got into bed a short time later, I found myself thinking about when I'd be ready to start dating. "Would I make a good girlfriend?"
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Later On

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Aaron was noticeably happier as we drove to school the next day; no doubt as a result of his date with Kelly. I made a note to ask her about it when I got to school; mostly because I wanted to see how she felt about it.

After saying goodbye to Aaron, I walked down the hall to Kelly's locker; where I saw her talking with Sam. Walking over to them, I said, "Morning, guys."

"Morning, Ally." Looking at me, Sam said, "Kelly was just telling me about her date with Aaron; seems like he was the perfect gentleman."

Turning to Kelly, I said, "How did you like bowling?"

"It was fun." Smiling, Kelly said, "I'm not sure; but I think Aaron let me win a few times."


We talked about the date for a few minutes; until the conversation changed to talking about the Homecoming Dance next week. Kelly and Sam were especially interested in going; now that they had dates lined up. On the other hand, I wasn't interested in going; I didn't have a date lined up and the thought of wearing a dress in public freaked me out.

Kelly had just finished telling Sam that they should go dress shopping this afternoon, when I said, "I don't think I'll be going with you guys this afternoon."

"What!?" looking at me, Sam said, "Ally, you've got to come with us."

"Why?" confused, I said, "What's the big deal if I don't come?"

Looking at me, Kelly said, "You've become one of our best friends since you came back; it wouldn't feel right for us to go dress shopping without you."

"I don't...wait, you guys consider me to be your best friend?"

"Yeah, I thought that was obvious." Looking at me, Sam said, "Don't you feel the same about us?"

"Yeah, I do." Pausing, I said, "It's just...a little weird; before this happened, you two wouldn't have been caught dead hanging out with me."


The three of us walked to class; as Sam and Kelly continued to explain why they considered me to be their best friend. As we were about to walk into class, Kelly said, "Besides, there's so much you can tell us about why boy's act the way they do."
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: At School

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The rest of the school day was uneventful; and before long I found myself driving to the mall with Kelly and Sam.

After parking my car, we walked into the mall and made our way to JcPenny. As we walked, I turned to them and said, "I-I don't know if this is such a good idea." Pausing, I said, "I don't think I'm ready for this."

"What's the big deal with shopping for a dress?" looking at me, Kelly said, "You were fine with wearing a bikini."

"That was different, Kelly." Sighing, I said, "That was in my backyard where only a few people saw me; I'm not sure I can wear a dress to a school dance where everyone would see me."

"I think you need to do this, Ally." Turning to me, Sam said, "To prove once and for all that you're a girl; so people stop thinking that you're a freak."

Nodding in agreement, Kelly said, "Besides, it's not like we're going to force you to buy the most feminine dress we can find."

Hearing them say that started to calm me down; as I looked to them and said, "I guess you're right; as long is the dress isn't too girly."


We spent several hours looking at dresses; most of which were too girly for my tastes. After Kelly and Sam had picked out theirs, they helped me to make a choice. The effort seemed to be futile, until I came across a dress that even I thought was perfect (http://www.homecomingdresses2012sale.com...).

Turning to Sam and Kelly, I smiled and said, "I think this is the one."

Exchanging glances with each other, they both turned to me and said, "It's perfect."

After paying for our dresses, the three of us grabbed a bite to eat at the food court before heading back to my car.


I got home a short time later; after dropping Kelly and Sam off at school to grab their cars. After grabbing the dress, I walked inside. I was about to walk upstairs when I saw Aaron walking out of the kitchen.

Seeing the garment bag, he said, "What's in the bag?"

"I was dress shopping with Sam and Kelly." Blushing, I said, "T-This is my homecoming dress."
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: After School (At the mall)

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I opened the bag to give Aaron a glimpse of my dress. Looking at me, he said, "It's a very pretty dress, Ally. But," biting his lip, Aaron said, "Isn't it a little feminine for you?"

Taken aback, I looked at Aaron and said, "What do you mean?"

"Up until now you've been the 'pretty tomboy' type." Wincing, Aaron said, "I don't think that dress is really you."

"I don't know who I am, okay!?" fighting tears, I said, "I'm trying to find myself; which isn't easy with people telling me that this is or isn't me!"

Taking a step back, Aaron said, "I'm just trying to help, Ally."

Throwing the garment bag at Aaron, I yelled, "Just leave me alone, Aaron!"

Before Aaron could react, I ran upstairs to my room and closed the door.


At little while later, after I'd calmed down a little, I decided to talk to Sam on Skype. When she answered the call, she said, "Whoa, what happened to you?"

"I've been...crying." pausing, I said, "I got into a rather heated discussion with Aaron."

Concerned, Sam said, "What did he do?"

"He didn't do anything." Sighing, I said, "He just said that he didn't think the dress I bought was the right one for me."

"Oh." Pausing, Sam said, "Do you want Kelly and I talk with him?"

"No thanks, I can handle it." Pausing, I said, "I just thought that of all people, my little brother would be supportive of me."


Sam and I talked for a little while; before she ended the call to get ready for work. I was playing a game on my computer; when there was a knock at the door. Getting up, I opened the door to find Aaron standing there with the garment bag.

Looking at me, he said, "Can I come in?"

"Sure." Stepping aside, I said, "Come on in."

Closing the door, Aaron said, "I'm sorry about earlier; I-I was just trying to help you."

"You can help by supporting me rather than criticizing me!" my lips quivering, I said. "Do you think this was something I felt comfortable doing? Ever since I got back to school, I've had to deal with people thinking I'm a freak."

"Is that why you bought that dress?" Looking at me, Aaron said, "To prove to the naysayers that you're a girl now?"

"Yeah, I guess so." Running a hand through my hair, I said, "I-I just want people to stop teasing me about this; I never asked to be a girl."

To my surprise, Aaron pulled me into hug. Looking at me, he said, "I don't think you're giving the kids at school enough credit, Ally."

Confused, I looked at him and said, "What are you talking about?"

"Some of them may think you're a freak; but they're dead wrong." Looking at me, Aaron said, "I've seen the way some of the guys at school look at you; and they don't see you as a freak."

Still confused, I said, "How do they see me then?"

"They see you as an attractive girl."

"What?" shocked, I said, "I'm...att-attractive?"

"Of course you are; why would you think you're not?" pausing, Aaron said, "You look a lot like mom when she was your age."


Aaron and I talked for a while; smoothing things over following our argument. Looking at him, I said, "Do you really think the dress is pretty?"

"Yeah, I do." Pausing, Aaron said, "I think you'll look great in it."

"Thanks." Smiling, I said, "Now comes the hard part."

Momentarily confused, Aaron said, "What might that be?"

With a grin, I said, "Finding a date for the dance."
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Aaron's Reaction

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
After talking with Aaron for a while about school and the upcoming homecoming dance, I decided it was time to work on my homework. I worked on homework until dad came home from work; after which time we had dinner.

As we sat down at the table, Aaron turned to dad and said, "Ally bought a dress for the homecoming dance."

"Really?" turning to me, Dad said, "I'd love to see it, honey."

Blushing, I said, "Okay dad, but after dinner."

The rest of dinner was spent talking about school and plans for the week. I explained how I was going to Sam's house to work on a project tomorrow night. Once dinner was finished, I helped clean the dishes before going upstairs.


It took some effort but I managed to get the courage to put on the dress to show it to Dad and Aaron. After making sure it was comfortable, I took a deep breath and walked downstairs to where Dad and Aaron were watching a baseball game.

I felt hurt when I saw that; since I used to watch the game with them before my accident. I couldn't help but think that even my own father was treating me differently now that I was a girl.

Getting their attention, I said, "Well...how do I look?"

Both Aaron and dad looked me at me with shocked looks on their faces. Aaron was the first to speak; as he looked at me and said, "You look...great, Ally."

With a smile, Dad said, "You look so much like your mother."

Looking at them, I said, "You don't think it's too...girly?"

"Not at all, honey." Looking at me, Dad said, "That dress is perfect for you."


After changing out of the dress, I put on my pajamas and walked back downstairs. Looking at Dad, I said, "Mind if I join you guys?"

"Sure, honey." Nodding, Dad said, "Have a seat."
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Later on

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
It was pouring when Aaron and I got to school the next morning. After finding a spot close to the school, we grabbed our things and got out of the car. As walked towards the school, Aaron turned to me and said, "At least promise me you'll think about what I said?"

Ever since he learned I actually wanted to go to homecoming, Aaron had been giving me suggestions for guys that might be interested in going to the dance with me.

"I'll think about it, alright?" Looking at him, I said, "To be completely honest, I'm leaning towards asking if Patrick wants to go to the dance with me; I'd rather go with someone I know and trust then with someone who might try to take advantage of me."

"Okay." Chuckling, Aaron said, "That sounds like a good decision to me."

Once inside the school, I turned to Aaron and said, "You're on your own to get home this afternoon; don't forget I'm going to Sam's to work on a project."


After saying goodbye to Aaron, I made my way through the halls. Instead of going to my locker, I decided it was best to talk to Patrick before I changed my mind.

I found him standing at his locker; placing some things inside. Hearing me walk up, he said, "Morning Ally."

"Morning, Pat." Pausing, I said, "I-I need to talk to you about something."

I proceeded to tell Pat that after buying a dress for homecoming, I realized I needed a date to the dance. When I was finished, he looked at me and said, "You want to go to the dance with me?"

"Yeah, if that's not too awkward for you." Taking a breath, I said, "Eric's going with Sam and Aaron's going with Kelly; which would leave the two of us without dates of our own."

Taking a breath, Patrick said, "I'd love to take you to the dance, Ally."

"Thanks, Pat." Giving him a hug, I said, "I appreciate it."

As I turned to walk away, I failed to notice the smile on Pat's face; as if I'd made his day by asking him to the dance.


With that out of the way, I met up with Kelly and Sam at my locker. As we walked to Chemistry class, I told them how I'd asked Patrick to the dance. They were both surprised by that; especially since he was one of my best friends.

"Isn't that going to be a little awkward for you, Ally?" looking at me, Kelly said, "I mean he's a guy and...you're a girl."

"I think you're jumping the gun a little bit, Kelly." Getting the gist of what she was saying, I said, "I'm just going to the dance with my friend; it's not like we're going to hook up afterwards."

"Relax, girl." Chuckling, Kelly said, "I'm just messing around with you; I'm glad you found a date for the dance."
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Next Day

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The rest of the day proceeded normally; I ate lunch with Kelly and Sam as usual. Even as I ate with them, I couldn't help but wonder if Patrick and Eric felt left out because of the fact that I barely spent any time with them since I woke up.

After school got out for the day, I was walking with Kelly to my locker. As we walked, she turned to me and said, "You've been awfully quite; is something wrong?"

"Nothing's wrong; I'm just...thinking."

Stopping to look at me, Kelly said, "About what?"

I proceeded to tell Kelly about my fight with Aaron yesterday; and how quickly he seemed to want to help me find a date for the dance. When I was finished, I said, "I'm fine with going to the dance with Patrick; because I can trust that he won't do anything." Pausing, I said, "I'm just surprised that Aaron was so enthusiastic about helping me find a date."

"I think I'm to blame for that." Pausing, Kelly said, "After your fight, Aaron called me to talk. Among other things, I told him that perhaps he should show his support for you by trying to set you up with one of his friends."

"Thanks for that, I guess." Arriving at my locker, I said, "Do you think I'm making the right choice by going with Patrick?"

"Of course; he's your friend and someone who you can trust." With a grin, Kelly said, "Maybe there's a chance for romance."

"Eww!" pausing, I said, "I'm not ready for a relationship; even if I was I don't think I'd date Patrick."

"Why?" looking at me, Kelly said, "Is something wrong with him?"

"No, there's nothing wrong with him." Getting defensive, I said, "It's just that he's one of my best friends; dating him would be...weird."

"Relax, Ally; I was just messing with you." Chuckling, Kelly said, "I'm sure you'll find the right person when you're ready; be it a boy or a girl."

"Thanks, Kelly." Opening my locker, I said, "I'll see you tomorrow; I'm supposed to go to Sam's to start our project."

"Sounds like fun." Chuckling, Kelly said, "See you tomorrow."
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: After School

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I got to Sam’s house a short time later; parking in the road just as Sam was getting out of her car. Being a few months older than Kelly; she already had her driver’s license. As I walked up to her, she said, “You ready to work on this project?”

“As ready as I’ll ever be.” Gesturing to my bag, I said, “I grabbed all the books I could find about World War 2; so hopefully that will give us a good start.”

After letting us into the house, Sam turned and led me upstairs to her room. Stopping outside of her closed door, Sam turned to me and said, “I apologize about the mess; I haven’t had much chance to clean it.”

Chuckling, I said, “You forget I used to be a boy, Sam; I’m used to messy rooms.”

With a grin, Sam opened the door and said, “You’ve been warned.”

Stepping inside Sam’s room, at first I thought I’d stepped into my room; there were clothes on the floor and sticking out of her dresser drawers. That wasn’t the biggest surprise; I noticed she had an Xbox 360 in her room.

Turning to her, astonished, I said, “I always pictured you as more of a neat and tidy person, Sam.”

"What, a girl can't be messy?" Feigning offense, Sam said, "You sound like my mom; always trying to get me clean my room and all that stuff."


The conversation continued like that for a few minutes; until we started working on the project. While that happened, the conversation inevitably turned to what had happened the night before. I was reading a book about the Battle of Midway; when Sam said, “Penny for your thoughts, Ally?”

Putting the book down, I said, “I modeled the dress for my dad and brother last night; they thought it was nice.”

“Why are you so gloomy then?” looking at me, Sam said, “I thought you’d like that.”

“I did like that; I guess I’m becoming more like a girl in that sense.” Chuckling, I said, “I’m starting to appreciate when people say I look nice.”

“Then why are you so upset?”

I proceeded to explain how after I’d changed out of the dress, I went downstairs to find dad and Aaron watching the baseball game. “Before my accident, Dad would’ve asked me to join him as well.” Sighing, I said, “I’m starting to wonder if subconsciously they’re starting to treat me like a girl; as if I wouldn’t find baseball interesting anymore.”

“I can see how that would upset you.” Pausing, Sam said, “How about you talk to them about your feelings; reassure them that you still think like a guy even if you’ve got the body of a girl.”

“Thanks, Sam.” In the hope of changing the subject, I spotted a photo of Sam and Eric on her nightstand. “How are things going with Eric?”

“Great!” blushing, Sam said, “He’s a really sweet guy; I’m glad I got a chance to know him better.”

With a giggle, I said, “Are you guys going to get serious?”

“I don’t know.” Giggling, Sam said, “I wouldn’t say it’s not a possibility.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: At Sam's

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I stayed at Sam's house for several more hours; alternating between working on the project and watching TV. After saying goodbye to Sam, I grabbed my things and walked out to my car.

It was just after 5:00 when I got home; walking inside to find that Aaron and Dad were already home. After placing my things in my room, I joined my family for dinner.

We spent dinner talking to each other about our days; dad talked about how he had a big meeting tomorrow for a new project while Aaron talked about how he surprised Kelly at work. When it came time for me to say how my day went, I got the feeling that they weren't really interested.


After putting the dishes away, I went upstairs to brush my teeth while Dad and Aaron did their own thing. Walking downstairs a short time later, I saw Aaron watching TV; without even asking if I wanted to join.

Taking a deep breath, I grabbed the remote from Aaron's hand and turned the TV off. As I stood in front of them, Aaron said, "I was watching that!"

Looking at him, annoyed, I said, "How come you didn't ask me if I wanted to watch the movie?"

"I guess it just slipped my mind." Pausing, Aaron said, "I wasn't sure you'd be interested."

"Why wouldn't I be interested?" shocked, I said, "We always watched movies together."

"Yeah, but that was before your accident." Looking at me, Aaron said, "Things are...different now."

"Different?" confused, I said, "How are things different?"
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Back Home (Later On)

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Well...you're a girl now." Fumbling for words, Aaron said, "I didn't think girls liked these kinds of movies."

Suddenly angrier than I've been in a while, I said, "What!?" gesturing to my breasts, I said, "Do you think that just because I have these, I'm suddenly your typical girl!?"

Getting nervous, Aaron said, "Um...yeah, I guess so."

"I've got news for you, brother." screaming in frustration, I said, "I may be a girl now; but I'm still the same person where it counts that I was 6 months ago. I don't understand why you can't see that!?"

Just then dad walked into the room; having heard the commotion. "What's going on in here!?"

"You guys have been leaving me out of everything lately; and now Aaron forgets to ask if I wanted to watch a movie with him." Giving dad a hurtful look, I said, "Aaron said it was because I'm a girl now."

Wincing, Dad looked at me and said, "Actually..."

I burst into tears as I looked from Aaron to dad; saying, "You thought the same thing!?"

"Ally, listen to me..."

I didn't pay any attention to either of them as I turned and ran out of the house in tears; slamming the door as I left. It wasn't long before Dad ran after me.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: How Things Change

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I ran for what seem like an eternity; when in reality I only ran half a block. Walking into the neighborhood park, I sat down on a nearby bench. I continued to cry; still upset about what happened at the house.

I was so deep in my thoughts that I didn't hear dad until he said, "Mind if I sit down, sweetie?"

In an annoyed tone, I said, "Go right ahead."

Sitting next to me, Dad said, "You want to talk about what happened?"

"You know, just because I'm a girl now doesn't mean I don't have feelings!" looking at Dad, I said, "With mom gone, all I have is you and Aaron to turn to for advice...but you're both brushing me off!"

"I promise you, that wasn't our intention!" placing a hand on my shoulder, Dad said, "What do you say we go home and watch the movie together, as a family."

"No, I'm too mad at both of you right now." Pausing, I said, "I'm grabbing some things and then I'm heading to Sam's."

"Okay sweetheart, if that's what you want to do." Sighing, Dad said, "Maybe we can sort this all out after school tomorrow."

Getting up, I said, "Yeah, maybe."

Dad and I were silent during the walk home; I wasn't in the mood for conversation. After getting home, I got some things together and left for Sam's. I called her as I drove down the road and explained what happened; she said to come on over.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Talking With Dad

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I got to Sam's house about 15 minutes later; parking in the road and getting out of the car to find Kelly walking towards me. Seeing that she was carrying a sleeping bag, I looked at her and said, "What's with the sleeping bag?"

"Sam called and told me that you're having a rough night." Hugging me, Kelly said, "She thought you could use some girl time."

"She's right." Breaking the hug, I grabbed my things and followed Kelly to the door. "I got annoyed with Aaron and my dad tonight; I guess my frustration over everything that's happened got the best of me."

After ringing the doorbell, Kelly turned to me and said, "Sam and I will do our best to help you, Ally."

"Thanks, Kelly." Smiling, I said, "I appreciate that."


It wasn't long before Sam's older brother Mark answered the door. Looking at Kelly and me, he said, "Hey girls; come on in."

Walking into the house, following behind Kelly, I said, "Thanks, Mark."

Glancing at me as he closed the door, Mark said, "No problem, Ally."

For a moment I thought I caught a glimpse of Mark staring at me as I went up the stairs; but I quickly pushed that thought aside. I realized that I was rather attractive as a girl; but I didn't think that boys would consider me attractive...especially since I used to be one of them.

Following Kelly upstairs, it wasn't long before we found ourselves in Sam's bedroom.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: At Sam's

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Given the mood that I found myself in, I was grateful that Sam and Kelly were helping me through it. After talking about what had happened with Aaron for a little while, they decided it was best for me to keep my mind off that.

It was a little before 8:00 when Sam returned from the bathroom to find me lying face down on my sleeping back with my shirt off and bra undone. Sam had an amused look on her face when she saw that Kelly was giving me a massage.

Chuckling, Sam said, "What are you doing, Kelly?"

"I've found that massages are a good way to reduce tension." Working on my shoulders and upper back, Kelly said, "Given the tension she's been under, Ally could really use one."

"Okay." With a grin on her face, Sam said, "Try not to enjoy yourself too much."

"Kelly, do you think Aaron would be jealous if he found out?" giggling, I said, "Maybe you give him a massage next time."

Blushing brightly, Kelly said, "O-Only if he asks first."

"Come on, Kelly." Joining in on the fun, Sam said, "I'm sure he'd love a massage from you."

Kelly didn't respond as she continued to massage my back; working her way down towards my waist. I giggled several times when she inadvertently tickled me.

After a few more minutes, she stopped and said, "Okay, you can put your bra back on." Sitting back, Kelly said, "It's time for the other side."

Thinking back to what Sam had said when she came in, I started to wonder if perhaps Kelly was enjoying this. I was about to say something when Sam's bedroom door opened, revealing her younger brother Carl. "Hey guys..."

Carl stopped mid-sentence when he saw my bare back lying on the sleeping back. Looking at Carl, Sam said, "What do you want, Carl?"

"Eww!!" Turning to Sam, Carl said, "Why didn't you tell me you were girl bonding!?"

"Hey twerp, we're girl bonding!" getting up, Sam said, "Get what you need and get out!

"Can I at least get something to eat?"

"Just raid the fridge like you always do." In a softer tone, Sam said, "We've got a bit of a crisis here."

Looking worried, Carl said, "Anything I can do?"

"No, it's a girl thing." Pausing, Sam said, "Thanks, though."

After Carl left, I sat up and put my bra back on. Looking at Sam, I said, "You've got a nicer relationship with Carl than I do with Aaron, Sam."

"We weren't always that close, Ally; it took a lot of work." Looking at me, Sam said, "You have to be patient; you're rebuilding your relationship with Aaron from the ground up."

With that Sam got up and walked out of the room; going to grab a movie for us to watch. Once she was gone, I lay down on my back to allow Kelly to continue the massage. This was something I never expected to happen; getting a massage from an attractive girl...while being a girl myself.


The massage continued for a little while until Kelly said, "I think that's good enough; how do you feel?"

"I feel much better, Kelly." Sitting up, I said, "Thanks for that."

"No problem, Ally." Pausing, Kelly said, "That's what friends are for."

At that moment, I realized just how much I valued Kelly as a friend; she was one of the first people outside my family to accept me for who I was. Before I knew what was happening, I leaned forward and kissed her on the lips.

Kelly simply sat there for a moment before kissing me back. We kissed for a few moments before I broke the kiss; happy to see that our special bond was still there. Both Kelly and I started blushing as we looked at each other.


Taking a breath, I said, "I won't tell Aaron if you don't."

"Okay." Nodding, Kelly said, "Sounds like a plan to me."
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Sleepover

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
After a rather enjoyable girls' night at Sam's house, I was in a much better mood. It was nice to know that although things were different now, I could still count on my friends. Walking into school the next morning, I saw Aaron talking with a few friends of his.

He cautiously waved to me; hoping that I'd come over and talk. I simply smiled and walked down the hall to my locker. As I walked down the hall, I accidentally walked into a guy walking down the hall.

"I'm so sorry." Pausing, I said, "I should've been watching where I was going."

"It's alright." Blushing, the boy said, "It was my fault."

I continued walking down the hall; unaware that the boy was watching me as I walked off. The rest of my day passed by uneventfully; except for the several times that I saw that guy again. It was as if he was following me everywhere; starting to freak me out.


After school ended for the day, I grabbed some things from my locker and went to the door. As I did, I saw the guy walking down the hallway again. Determined to put a stop to this, I turned the corner and stopped. I waited for the guy to appear; and when he did I pulled him into a nearby stairwell.

Shoving him into the wall, I said, "Why have you been following me around all day!?"

"I-I was-wasn't following you around."

"Yes you were; I saw you in the library, the hallway and the cafeteria." Looking at him, I said, "Did you just want to get a good look at me?"

"N-No, it's nothing like that." Blushing, the boy said, "I-I was just wondering if you'd like to go on a date with me?"

I stepped back when he said that; not expecting that at all. Confused, I ran a hand through my hair and said, "You're doing this to mess with me, right?" pausing, I said, "I mean, you know who I am?"

"I'm being serious!" blushing even more, the boy said, "I-I think you're attractive!"

My ego kicking in, I said, "R-Really?" pausing, I said, "Why are you telling me this? I used to be a guy; so what makes you think I'd date one?"

"But you're a girl now, right?" looking at me, he said, "What difference does it make?"

"You don't get it, do you?" looking at him, I said, "I may look like a girl, but that doesn't mean I act like one.'

"I-I just thought that since you used to be a guy; that things would be...easier."

"Look, I understand what you're getting at. But," getting frustrated, I said, "Here's the thing, I...Am...Not...Interested."

Looking at me, the boy said, "O-Okay, I-I understand."

I watched as the boy slowly picked up his things and walked out of the stairwell; with a disappointed look on his face. As he left, I suddenly found myself feeling horrible about what I'd just done. As a boy I never had much luck with girls; so I could understand where the kid was coming from. Now that I was a girl, I was suddenly on the other side of the conversation.

Leaning against the wall, I said to myself, "I can't believe I just did that."
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Next Day

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I managed to put that guy out my mind by the time I got home; I didn't want to let it get in the way of my homework. After walking inside, I said hi to Aaron before heading up to my room.

Once inside the room, I closed the door and sat down on my bed. Grabbing my laptop from my bedside table, I turned it on and started my homework. I worked on that for about an hour before deciding to take a break.

Getting up from the bed, I opened my bedroom door a crack to find that Aaron had his bedroom door closed with his music playing. Closing the door again, I took of my shorts and sat back down on the bed wearing only my top, a bra and panties.

Deciding to see what Kelly was up to, I logged into Skype and called her. She answered after a few seconds, her image appearing on my screen. "Hey Ally; what's up?"

"Not much; I'm taking a break from doing homework and thought I'd call you."

With a grin on her face, Kelly said, "I heard you had a little excitement after school today; some boy asked you out on a date."

Shocked, I said, "How did you hear about that?"

"Come now, Ally." With a grin, Kelly said, "You of all people know how quickly news travels in our school."

"How can I forget; the rumor mill never ends there." Sighing, I said, "I couldn't believe it when he asked me out; I thought he might've been playing a trick on me."

"What would make you think that?"

"Are you serious, Kelly?" pausing, I said, "I'm a girl who used to be a guy; why would anyone ask me out on a date?"

"Did you ever stop to think that it's because you're attractive?" smiling, Kelly said, "I've seen how the stares you get at school; from boys and girls alike."

"Oh great; that's all I need." Sighing, I said, "I'm having a hard enough time adjusting already; I don't want people flirting with me."

"It's not all bad, Ally." Giggling, Kelly said, "Give it a chance after a while; you may like the attention."

"Maybe, I don't know." Pausing, I said, "I don't want to think about that right now."

"I'll tell you what." Turning serious, Kelly said, "Sam's going away this weekend for a family reunion; so how about the two of us have a sleepover at my place. Think of it as a way to unwind after a hectic."

"That sounds like a good idea to me." Smiling, I said, "I'll tell my dad that's what I'm doing."

"Great!" smiling, Kelly said, "I got to go; I need to let my dog out."

After logging off from Skype, I went back to doing my homework.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Back Home

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I decided it was best to talk with Dad and Aaron during dinner; so when I walked into the kitchen a few hours later, I said, "Guys, I think there are a few things we need to discuss."

Both Dad and Aaron turned to look at me with confused looks on their faces. Aaron was the first one to speak. "Okay, like what?"

"How you guys have been acting around me, for starters." Sitting down at the table, as dad served the dinner, I said, "I get that you both got used to not having me around for 6 months; but is it too hard to ask that you include me in your activities?"

"I can see why that would upset you, sweetheart. I promise we'll do better from now on." Looking at Aaron, Dad said, "Isn't that right, Aaron?"

"Right, Dad." Looking at me, Aaron said, "I'll do better in the future."

"Thanks." Taking a bit of my lasagna, I said, "Now onto the other problem."

Taking a breath, Aaron said, "I'm almost afraid to ask."

Glaring at him, I said, "Just because I'm a girl now; doesn't mean we can't spend time together. I still have all the same interests."

"Are you sure about that, Ally?" looking at me, Aaron said, "Do you really still have all the same interests?"

Feeling a little confused, I said, "What's that supposed to mean?"

"It seems to me like you're spending more time with Kelly and Sam now that you're out of the hospital." Sighing, Aaron said, "I can't help but think you like being with them more than do with Patrick, Eric and me."

"They're my friends, Aaron; they've been a big help getting me to adjust to all of this." Pausing, I said, "Just because I'm spending more time with girls doesn't mean I'm going to start acting like one."

"I'm just saying." Looking at me, Aaron said, "Don't forget about your other friends; we're all here to help you."

I wasn't in the mood to talk anymore after that, so I finished my dinner in silence before going upstairs to finish my homework.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Later On (Talking with Dad & Aaron)

choices: The Next Day (Spending Time With Melissa)
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I was in a bit of funk during school the next day; mainly because of my conversation with dad and Aaron the night before. Kelly and Sam could tell I was depressed during lunch; they tried cheering me up after I explained why I wasn't in a good mood.

After school finally got out, I said goodbye to Kelly and Sam before quietly grabbing my things. As I walked through the parking lot to my car, I was surprised when Dad pulled up next to me. Looking inside the car, I saw Aaron sitting in the back seat.

A little curious, I walked to the front of the car as Dad rolled the window down. "Get in, Ally; I'm taking you both someplace."

"Dad, I have plans with..."

"That wasn't a request, young lady!" getting serious, Dad said, "Get in the car; or I'll drag you in!"

Suddenly feeling frightened, I quickly got in the front seat as dad drove off. "Where are we going, dad?"

"You'll see."


It wasn't long before we arrived at the cemetery where Mom was buried. "What are we doing here, dad?"

As Dad led Aaron and me to mom's grave, he said, "For the same reason I come here every day.

Looking at mom's tombstone, I said, "You come here every day?"

"She was my wife, Allison; I loved her more than anything." Turning to me and Aaron, he said, "I love you two with all my heart; and nothing will ever change that!"

Stepping back, I said, "Dad, you're scaring me."

"I promised your mother I'd always be here for both of you; and I have worked very hard to keep that promise." Pausing, Dad said, "Aaron and I will work harder to involve you in our lives; but you have to meet us halfway."

Confused, I said, "What do you mean?"

"I don't even know who your friends are anymore; you hardly talk about them or what you do in your free time."

"Honestly, I thought what I did with Kelly and Sam would bore you, dad..." pausing, I realized what Dad was getting at. With a sigh, I said, "Okay, I get your point."

Looking at me, Dad said, "You can spend time with your friends, Ally; but I hope you remember we're here as well."

"I'll make sure to spend more time with you too." Pausing, I said, "I promise."

"Good; that's all I wanted to hear." Turning to Aaron, Dad said, "Is there anything you want to add, Aaron?"

"Yeah, there is." Turning to me, Aaron said, "I hope you realize that I still love you, Ally; even if it seems like I've ignored you since you came out of the coma."

"Of course I know that, Aaron!" pulling Aaron into a hug, I said, "I love you too; you're my little brother and that will never change."

We stayed at the cemetery for a while longer before we left. After I was dropped off at school to pick up my car, I drove home to work on my homework.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: After School (The Next Day)

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
School was uneventful the next day; I spent my free time with Sam and Kelly. With Sam getting psyched about her weekend getaway, Kelly and I started to plan our weekend together.

As we walked out of the building after school was finished for the day, Sam turned to Kelly and me. "You two have been talking about your weekend all day; there's not some ulterior motive is there?"

Casting a quick glance to me, Kelly turned to Sam and said, "There's no ulterior motive, Sam; we're just two girls who are spending the weekend together."

"Okay." Looking as if she didn't believe Kelly, Sam said, "I don't what any surprises when I come back on Monday, alright?"

With a chuckle, I turned to Sam and said, "Relax, Sam; nothing's going to happen."

"Okay." Sighing, Sam said, "I've got the afternoon off, you guys want to do something?"

"I'd love to hang out. But," pausing, I said, "I'm getting together with my cousin Melissa in a few hours; so I can finally meet my fellow bridesmaids."

"I still have a hard time believing that you actually agreed to be a bridesmaid." Looking at me, with a grin on her face, Sam said, "You haven't even been a girl for a month yet."

"Don't remind me." Chuckling, I said, "But Melissa and I were always close...before the accident; I didn't want to turn down her offer."

Smiling, Kelly said, "At least you've got a few months to get ready."

"That's true; at least there's that." Nodding, I said, "I'll see you guys tomorrow."

After we parted ways, I turned and walked through the parking lot to my car. Once I drove out of the parking lot, I started the 20 minute drive to Melissa's apartment.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Next Day (After School)

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I got to Melissa's apartment complex about 20 minutes later; pulling into the parking lot just as it started to rain. After finding a parking spot, I grabbed my things and made my way to the entrance.

Taking the elevator up to the 3rd floor, I walked down the hall and knocked on the door. It wasn't long before the door opened and I was greeted by Melissa's younger sister Amanda. She was 2 years older than me; while we are cousins, we didn't spend a whole lot of time together.

"Come on in, Allison." Looking at me, Amanda said, "Melissa wants to introduce you to the others."

As I walked into the apartment, I got the feeling that my relationship with Amanda wasn't going to change now that I was a girl. In an attempt to know for sure, I turned to her and said, "I know we haven't always been close; but, uh, are we...okay?"

"Why wouldn't we be okay, Allison?" Closing the door, Amanda turned to me and said, "You may have had a sex change; but you're still family."

With a weak smile, I said, "Do you think there's any chance of our relationship improving?"

"I don't know." Looking at me, Amanda said, "To be honest, it's a little discomforting to know that you're a girl now."

"I know the feeling." Sighing, I said, "I'm still coming to terms with all of this."

Just then Melissa walked out of her bedroom. "I thought I heard voices out here."

Walking over to her, I gave Melissa a hug and said, "Thanks for inviting me over, Mel."

"Nonsense, Ally." Hugging me back, Melissa said, "You're one of my bridesmaids, you should be included in the planning for the wedding."

Once that was finished, I followed Melissa and Amanda out onto the porch; where we waited for the others to arrive.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: At Melissa's

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I spent time with Amanda and Melissa while we waited for the other bridesmaids to arrive. About 20 minutes after I'd gotten there, Melissa got up to get some drinks for us. Once she'd walked off the porch, Amanda came over and said next to me.

"You look great, Ally." Looking at me, Amanda said, "Those doctors did a really good job."

Shocked, I turned to Amanda and said, "A good job?"

"Yeah, they did a good job." Gesturing to my chest, Amanda said, "Your breasts are almost like mine."

Taken aback by that remark, getting annoyed, I said, "Thanks, I guess."

"You must be getting a lot of attention from the boys at school." Looking at me, Amanda said, "A girl with your figure is something boy's pay attention to."

Thinking back to the moment when that guy had asked me out, I said, "I've had a few guys flirt with me; but I wasn't interested." Sighing, I said, "To be honest, I'm don't really like the way they've been treating me."

"Have you ever thought about going on a date with one of them?" pausing, Amanda said, "That way you could see what it's like before you decide you're not into guys."

"Not even for a second." Turning to Amanda, I said, "I may have a girl's body; but I still think like a guy. I'm not going to go on a date with a guy; because I don't go that way."

Looking at me, realizing that she was getting on my nerves, Amanda said, "I didn't mean to get you upset, Ally."

"It's alright, Amanda." Sighing, I got up and walked over to the porch railing. Taking a deep breath, I turned to her and said, "I'm still learning to deal with everything that's happened; I mean it's not every day that you wake up to find you've been given a sex change."

Getting up to walk over to me, Amanda said, "I can understand why you feel that way; having your gender changed would cause anyone to have doubts about who they are."

"Yeah, especially since I didn't ask to be turned into a girl." Leaning against the railing, I said, "I guess I can't fault my dad for doing what he thought was best; but it would've been nice to have a say in the decision. After all, he's not the one who has to adjust to a new gender."

Melissa walked back onto the patio at that moment; with some drinks in her hands. Handing a glass to me, Melissa said, "I heard you guys talking from the kitchen; what were you guys talking about?"

Knowing how Melissa felt about Amanda's inability to think before speaking, I decided not to go into detail. Taking a sip of my drink, a Sprite, I said, "We were just talking about how I was coping; and if anything interesting has happened at school since I got back."
